sospitatrix: <entryFree id="n44836" type="hapax" key="sospi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sospitator</etym>, <sense id="n44836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that saves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delivers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sospito: <entryFree id="n44837" type="main" key="sospi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sospĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sospes</etym>, <sense id="n44837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosper</hi> (syn.: salvum servare; an old word, belonging mostly to relig. lang.): regnum nostrum ut sospitent superstitentque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 4</bibl> (Trag. v. 330 Vahl.); so Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 472:15" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 472, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">progeniem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ex conject.: quin sospitabo plus sescentos in die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit> Ritschl ad h. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sospitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sostratus: <entryFree id="n44838" type="main" key="Sostra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sostrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sw/stratos</foreign>, <sense id="n44838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, esp. </sense><sense id="n44838.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 51 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44838.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An architect of Cnidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who built the tower of Pharos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 18, § 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44838.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A surgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7</bibl> praef.</sense></entryFree>
sosus: <entryFree id="n44839" type="main" key="Sosus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sosus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44840" type="main" key="Sosus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sosus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a book written by Antiochus against Philo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sotades: <entryFree id="n44841" type="main" key="So_ta^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōtădes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swta/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n44841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obscene Greek poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44841.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sō-tădēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the manner of Sotades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:6" default="NO">1, 8, 6</bibl>; Ter. Maur. pp. 2415 and 2446 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 14, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44841.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōtădĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sotadic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: L. Attius in Sotadicorum libro, <hi rend="ital">Sotadic verses</hi>, Geli. 7, 9, 16.</sense></entryFree>
soter: <entryFree id="n44842" type="greek" key="So_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swth/r</foreign>. <sense id="n44842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A savior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giver of health</hi> or <hi rend="ital">safety</hi> is est nimirum soter, qui salutem dedit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sotera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">hodieque ara in Capitolio est Jovis Soteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 652</bibl></cit>; cf. Servator.—</sense><sense id="n44842.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44842.2" n="A" level="2"> Soter, <hi rend="ital">of Jesus the Saviour</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 16 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n44842.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Ptolemœus I.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
soteria: <entryFree id="n44843" type="main" key="so_te_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōtērĭa</orth>, ōrum. <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">swthria</foreign>, <sense id="n44843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festive entertainment given on a person's recovery from illness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">escape from danger; presents given on such an occasion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:56:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 56, 3</bibl>.—Hence, Soteria, <hi rend="ital">a congratulatory poem on such an occasion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sotericianus: <entryFree id="n44844" type="main" key="So_te_ri^ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōtērĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>Soter</etym>, <sense id="n44844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to the Saviour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sotericus: <entryFree id="n44845" type="main" key="So_te_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sōtērĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*swthriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, esp. </sense><sense id="n44845.1" n="1" level="3"> Sotericus Marcius, <hi rend="ital">a freedman in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44845.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A maker of furniture</hi>, Sen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sotiates: <entryFree id="n44846" type="main" key="Sotiates"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sotiates</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sott-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Aquitania, now <hi rend="ital">Sōs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Départ. du Gers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl> and 21.</sense></entryFree>
sozusa: <entryFree id="n44847" type="greek" key="so_zu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sōzūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sw/zousa</foreign>, <sense id="n44847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> artemisia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> serpyllum majus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spaco: <entryFree id="n44848" type="main" key="Spa_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spāco</orth>, <itype>cūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*spakw/</foreign>, <sense id="n44848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nurse of Cyrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spadicarius: <entryFree id="n44849" type="hapax" key="spa_di_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spādīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spadix</etym>, <sense id="n44849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that dyes a chestnut-brown color</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spadicum: <entryFree id="n44850" type="main" key="spa_di_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spādīcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. spadix.</entryFree>
spadix: <entryFree id="n44851" type="greek" key="spa_dix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spādix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa)dic</foreign>. <sense id="n44851.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a palm-branch broken off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with its fruit;</hi> spadica Dorici vocant avulsum e paimā termitem cum fructu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:9" default="NO">3, 9, 9</bibl>.—In the collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">spādīcum</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">termites et spadica cernit assidua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44851.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (as in Greek). </sense><sense id="n44851.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Date-brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nut-brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chestnut-brown</hi>: rutilus et spadix phoenicei <foreign lang="greek">sunw/numos</foreign>, Geli. 2, 26, 9 sq.: honesti (equi) Spadices glaucique,<cb n="SPAR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44851.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of stringed instrument</hi>, condemned as effeminate by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spado: <entryFree id="n44852" type="greek" key="spa^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spădo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/dwn</foreign>. <sense id="n44852.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who has no generative power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an impotent person</hi> (whether by nature or by castration; <cit><quote lang="la">hence more gen. Than castratus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:128" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:39" default="NO">23, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:6" default="NO">28, 2, 6</bibl>; 1, 7, 2; 40, 2, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. castratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>. —Of horses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44852.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a castrated person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a eunuch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:91 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 91 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44852.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seedless plants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 8, § 38</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a reed without down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spadonatus: <entryFree id="n44853" type="hapax" key="spa^do_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spădōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spado</etym>, <sense id="n44853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of a</hi> spado, <hi rend="ital">impotency</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spadoninus: <entryFree id="n44854" type="main" key="spa^do_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spădōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seedless</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spadonius: <entryFree id="n44855" type="main" key="spa^do_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spădōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spado, II.</etym>, <sense id="n44855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seedless</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spaerita: <entryFree id="n44856" type="greek" key="spaeri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spaerīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n44856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of round cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spagas: <entryFree id="n44857" type="gloss" key="spagas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spagas</orth>, <sense id="n44857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pitch found in Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spalathra: <entryFree id="n44858" type="main" key="Spala_^thra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spalā^thra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*spa/laqra</foreign>, <sense id="n44858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the Thessalian coast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spalax: <entryFree id="n44859" type="main" key="spa^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spălax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/lac</foreign>, <sense id="n44859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spalei: <entryFree id="n44860" type="main" key="Spalei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spalei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Tanais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparax: <entryFree id="n44861" type="main" key="Spa^ra_x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spărāx</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparganion: <entryFree id="n44862" type="greek" key="sparga^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spargănĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sparga/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n44862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant bur-weed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 63, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spargo: <entryFree id="n44863" type="main" key="spargo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spargo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n44863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> spargier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 8</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root sparç, to touch, sprinkle; M. H. Germ. Sprengen; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spei/rw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">throw about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter; to bestrew; to sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet; to bespatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn. sero). </sense><sense id="n44863.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:3" default="NO">2, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi, mortalia semina, dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per humum, nova semina, dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:573" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipereos dentes in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos populo de Rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 884</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 19, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: hastati spargunt hastas, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurl about</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 287 Vahl.): hastas, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 600</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 629</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sagittarius cum funditore utrimque spargunt, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44863.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of liquids, <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem passim toto terrarum in orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totam domum aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44863.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bestrew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargite humum foliis,</quote> <trans><tr>bestrew</tr>, <tr>strew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta fimo pingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molā caput salsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gruem sale multo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(jus) croco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerum capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 20, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:567 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 567 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44863.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To besprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, etc.: saxa spargens tabo, sanie et sanguine atro, <hi rend="ital">sprinkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wetting</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl> (Trag. v. 414 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aras sanguine multo quadrupedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram immolato agno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora genasque lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:977" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 977</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitā lacrimā favillam amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus fluviali lymphā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximos umore oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis aureis maculis sparsus,</quote> <trans><tr>sprinkled over</tr>, <tr>spotted</tr>, <tr>flecked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsā, non convolutā canitie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capreoli sparsis etiam nunc pellibus albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum nitidius, aure aut coloribus sparsum,</quote> <trans><tr>covered over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">priscis sparsa tabellis Livia Porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: sparso ore, adunco naso, <hi rend="ital">with a spotty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">freckled face</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: exi, Dave, Age, sparge: mundum esse hoc vestibulum volo, <hi rend="ital">sprinkle</hi>, * Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 4</bibl>: verrite aedes, spargite, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 183</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 130 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui verrunt, qui spargunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44863.5" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="SPAR" /> <hi rend="ital">To scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the class. dispergere, dissipare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus a rebus ... Perpetuo fluere ac mitti spargique necesse est Corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res sparsas et vage disjectas diligenter eligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aper) spargit canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:442" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsus silebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1394" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsam tempestate classem vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsi per vias speculatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum spargi per provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) sparsit haec (cornua) in ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentes radios in orbem (gemma),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sicoris) Spargitur in sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargas tua prodigus,</quote> <trans><tr>you dissipate</tr>, <tr>squander</tr>, <tr>waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 195</bibl></cit>: stare et spargere sese hastis, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 154 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">se in fugam passim spargere, Liv 33, 15, 15: saepe solet scintilla suos se spargere in ignes (shortly before, dissilire and dividi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus ab septentrione in lacus, ab occidente in amnem Mosam se spargit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum ab Argis Alciden,</quote> <trans><tr>to separate</tr>, <tr>part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:488" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsis consumptisque fratribus bello intestinae discordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44863.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44863.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos in corpora humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia spargere ac disseminare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparserat Argolicas nomen vaga Fama per urbes Theseos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera enim tractamus in species multas sese spargentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargit legiones, nova cottidie bello semina ministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44863.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44863.9" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to intersperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insert</hi> a word or words; of a report or rumor, <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noise abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to circulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">report</hi> (so perh. not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. dissemino): cum vigilans Quartae esto partis Ulixes Audieris heres: Ergo nunc Dama sodalis Nusquam est? etc.... Sparge subinde,</quote> <trans><tr>break in with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">' libris actorum spargere gaudes Argumenta viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere voces In vulgum ambiguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parentes crimina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama spargitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargebatur insuper, Albinum insigne regis et Jubae nomen usurpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n44863.10" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., of time: <cit><quote lang="la">satis multum temporis sparsimus,</quote> <trans><tr>wasted</tr>, <tr>consumed aimlessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">spread open</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsior racemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>: uberior Nilo, generoso sparsior istro, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:129" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44864" type="hapax" key="spargo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spargo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. spargo</etym>, <sense id="n44864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spray</hi>: salis, Ven. Ep. ad Felic. 3.</sense></entryFree>
sparsilis: <entryFree id="n44865" type="hapax" key="sparsi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be scattered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dispersed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta sparsilia eorum, qui Deo adulantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sparsim: <entryFree id="n44866" type="main" key="sparsim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sparsus, from 1. spargo</etym>, <sense id="n44866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scatteredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">here and there</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">defluere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeninisse haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sparsio: <entryFree id="n44867" type="main" key="sparsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. spargo</etym>. <sense id="n44867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sprinkling</hi> of perfumes in the theatres (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis feret hominem de sparsionibus dicentem odoratos imbres?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5</bibl></cit>, praef. § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6166</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A scattering</hi> of presents in the theatre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparsivus: <entryFree id="n44868" type="hapax" key="sparsi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for hurling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl></cit> dub. (al. prasina).</sense></entryFree>
sparsus: <entryFree id="n44869" type="main" key="sparsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sparsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. spargo.</entryFree>
sparta: <entryFree id="n44870" type="main" key="Sparta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sparta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (Gr. <case>acc.</case> Sparten, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 170</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*spa/rth</foreign>. <sense id="n44870.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The famous capital of Laconia</hi>, more usually called Lacedaemon, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Mistra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33, 58</bibl>; id. tusc. 2, 14, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:577 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 577 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 217 al.</bibl>— In Greek form, Cicero, in allusion to Euripides, has the word twice proverbially: <foreign lang="greek">*spa/rtan e)/laxes, tau/tan ko/smei</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Sparta is your country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make the most of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <pb n="1735" /> <cb n="SPAS" /> </sense><sense id="n44870.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the class. Lacedaemonius): <cit><quote lang="la">Hermione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:164" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <trans><tr>marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6" default="NO">4, 6</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 16</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Spartan</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl>, ext. 3 al.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:19:39" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 19, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 153</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44870.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n44870.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taenaros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 102, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44870.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 398</bibl></cit> Sill. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44870.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spar-tĭātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Spartan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 37</bibl>; 5, 27, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44870.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spartacus: <entryFree id="n44871" type="main" key="Sparta^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n44871.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Thracian gladiator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who carried on the war of the gladiators against the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:67:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 67, 12 sq.</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:30:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:5 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44871.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Mark Antony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen cum percussore, cum latrone, cum Spartaco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spartanus: <entryFree id="n44872" type="main" key="Sparta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sparta, A.</entryFree>
spartarius: <entryFree id="n44873" type="main" key="sparta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spartārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spartum</etym>, <sense id="n44873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to broom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing broom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago,</quote> <trans><tr>New Carthage</tr>, <tr>in Spain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spartārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">places where broom grows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparteolus: <entryFree id="n44874" type="main" key="sparte^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spartĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sparteus</etym>, <sense id="n44874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watchman against fire</hi> (so called from the ropes made of broom that were used at fires), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 305</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sparteus: <entryFree id="n44875" type="main" key="sparte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spartĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spartum</etym>, <sense id="n44875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of broom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of broom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 8</bibl>: spirae, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 107 Rib.): serilia, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. p. 91): <cit><quote lang="la">urnae, amphorae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">helcium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 220, 20</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spartĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a shoe made of broom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:1" default="NO">6, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 26, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sparti: <entryFree id="n44876" type="main" key="Sparti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sparti</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartoe</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*spa/rtoi</foreign> (the Sown, from <foreign lang="greek">spei/rw</foreign>), <sense id="n44876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the armed men who sprang up from the dragon's teeth sown by Cadmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 178" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spartiacus: <entryFree id="n44877" type="main" key="Sparti^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sparta, C.</entryFree>
spartianus: <entryFree id="n44878" type="main" key="Sparti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: Aelius, <sense id="n44878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman historian of the time of Diocletian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the</hi> scriptores Historiae Augustae; v. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 887 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
spartiates: <entryFree id="n44879" type="main" key="Sparti^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sparta, E.</entryFree>
spartiaticus: <entryFree id="n44880" type="main" key="Sparti^a_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sparta, B.</entryFree>
sparticus: <entryFree id="n44881" type="main" key="Sparti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spartĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sparta, D.</entryFree>
spartopolios: <entryFree id="n44882" type="greek" key="sparto^po^li^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spartŏpŏlĭos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spartopo/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n44882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl> (Jan. dub.; al. spartopolia).</sense></entryFree>
spartum: <entryFree id="n44883" type="greek" key="spartum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spartum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ton</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/rton</foreign>, <sense id="n44883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant originally growing in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which ropes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nets</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">were made</hi> (<hi rend="ital">still called in Spain esparto</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Spanish broom</hi>: Stipa tenacissima, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 7, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44883.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rope made of broom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 11, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparulus: <entryFree id="n44884" type="main" key="spa^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spărŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. sparus</etym>, <sense id="n44884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bream</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:106" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sparus: <entryFree id="n44885" type="main" key="spa^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n44885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form, <number>plur.</number> spara, Lucil. ap. Fest. pp. 330 and 331 Müll.; and id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a small missile weapon with a curved blade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a huntingspear</hi> (syn. venabulum), Varr. and Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 682</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:388" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:523" default="NO">8, 523</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44886" type="main" key="spa^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gilt-head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gilt-bream</hi>: Sparus aurata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spasmus: <entryFree id="n44887" type="greek" key="spasmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spasmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spasmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cramp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convulsion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spasm</hi> (post-Aug. for convulsio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 7, 24, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:110" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 12, 36, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 171" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2</bibl>, <cb n="SPAT" /> 3, 18.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">spasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/sma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 72, § 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spasticus: <entryFree id="n44888" type="greek" key="spasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">spastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with the cramp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spasms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spastic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 17, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 24, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spatale: <entryFree id="n44889" type="main" key="Spa^ta^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spătălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spata/lh</foreign>, deliciae, <sense id="n44889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a nymph</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:52:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 52, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spatalium: <entryFree id="n44890" type="main" key="spa^ta^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătălĭum</orth>, v. spathalium.</entryFree>
spatalocinaedus: <entryFree id="n44891" type="main" key="spatalo_cinaedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spatalō-cinaedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">spatalo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n44891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lewd person</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spatangius: <entryFree id="n44892" type="greek" key="spa^tangi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătangĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/taggos</foreign>, <sense id="n44892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-urchin</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
spatha: <entryFree id="n44893" type="greek" key="spa^tha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spa/qh</foreign>. <sense id="n44893.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooden instrument</hi> for stirring any liquid, <hi rend="ital">a spattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spatula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 26, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44893.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A batten</hi>, or broad piece of wood, used by the early weavers for driving home the threads of the woof or tram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44893.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-edged sword without a point</hi> (the Italian <hi rend="ital">spada</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 236, 28; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10</bibl>; Capitol. Max. jun. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44893.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spathe</hi> of a palmtree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 48, § 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44893.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> elate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 5, 53, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 269" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 269</bibl> (called also spathe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:134 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 62, § 134 al.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
spathalium: <entryFree id="n44894" type="greek" key="spa^tha^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spăthălĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spătăl-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spaqa/lion</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">spata/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n44894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bracelet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 52, § 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spathe: <entryFree id="n44895" type="main" key="spa^the_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spăthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. spatha, V.</entryFree>
spathula: <entryFree id="n44896" type="main" key="spa^thu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spăthŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. spatula.</entryFree>
spatiator: <entryFree id="n44897" type="main" key="spa^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spatior</etym>, <sense id="n44897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who walks about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a promenader</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; and id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spatiolum: <entryFree id="n44898" type="main" key="spa^ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spatium</etym>, <sense id="n44898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small space</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spatior: <entryFree id="n44899" type="main" key="spa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n44899.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take a walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to walk about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promenade</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulo, deambulo): cum resideret, deinde spatiaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in xysto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggere in aprico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeiā in umbrā (i. e. porticu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 75: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeiā sub umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in porticibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 573</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44899.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to walk about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, = incedere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(Dido) ante ora deum pingues spatiatur ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato arvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix sola in siccā secum spatiatur harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa spatietur,</quote> <trans><tr>will move along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">lato spatiata campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:71" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44899.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiantia passim Bracchia compescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiantes alae,</quote> <trans><tr>his spreading wings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:364" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices in summā tellure spatiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus, ut in metallis, spatiante venā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum nosse, et vires ejus, antequam spatientur, opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spatiose: <entryFree id="n44900" type="main" key="spa^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. spatiosus <sense id="n44900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spatiositas: <entryFree id="n44901" type="main" key="spa^ti^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spatiosus</etym>, <sense id="n44901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wideness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spaciousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
spatiosus: <entryFree id="n44902" type="main" key="spa^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spatium</etym>, <sense id="n44902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of great extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ample</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spacious;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; not in Cic.; syn.: latus, amplus, laxus). </sense><sense id="n44902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina fumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus (opp. parva vipera),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa pectoris (with ingentes umeri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:244" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergus in guttura, Ov M. 11, 754: limes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 15:849" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 14:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20</bibl></cit> (Merkel, speciosa): voces, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of many syllables</hi> (corresp. to amplitudo dactyli), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:136" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 136</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiosiora quam decem pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (opp. contractiora): <cit><quote lang="la">Andromache spatiosior aequo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 645</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non spatiosior alter innumeras cepisse rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:481 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 481 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatiosissima sedes hominum deorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44902.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44902.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <cb n="SPAT" /> <hi rend="ital">long-continuing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolonged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:623" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44902.4" n="B" level="2"> Of other things, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna et spatiosa res est sapientia: vacuo illi loco opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n44902.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Widely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extensively</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 29, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:129" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 47, § 129</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44902.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Long; comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a later time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 11</bibl> (4, 20, 3).</sense></entryFree>
spatium: <entryFree id="n44903" type="main" key="spa^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root spa-, to draw; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spa/w</foreign>; span-, to stretch; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spa/nis</foreign>, want; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">pe/nomai, pe/nhs</foreign>; Germ. spannen; Dor. <foreign lang="greek">spa/dion</foreign> (=<foreign lang="greek">sta/dion</foreign>), race-course; cf. Lat. penuria</etym>, <sense id="n44903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a space</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44903.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44903.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: est natura loci spatiumque profundi, Quod neque percurrere flumina possint, Nec, etc.... Usque adeo passim patet ingens copia rebus; <cit><quote lang="la">Finibus exemptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1002" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1002</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:370" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 389</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ac spatium, quod inane vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 426</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 523</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per totum caeli spatium diffundere sese (solis lux),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tres pateat caeli spatium non amplius ulnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Dubis paene totum oppidum cingit: reliquum spatium, quā flumen intermittit, mons continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus rerum et spatiis locorum animadversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod spatium non esset agitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatio distante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44903.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> (limited) <hi rend="ital">space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi> (syn. intervallum): <cit><quote lang="la">siderum genus spatiis immutabilibus ab ortu ad occasum commeans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno spatio paucis diebus confecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae spatium,</quote> <trans><tr>the distance</tr>, <tr>length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes paribus intermissae spatiis (shortly before: paribus intervallis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alios ineunt cursus aliosque recursus Adversi spatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 584</bibl></cit> Coningt. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus aequo fere spatio ab castris utrisque aberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duas acies tantum erat relictum spatii, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Viridorix contra eum duum milium spatio consedisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum spatium abesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tanta machinatio ab tanto spatio institueretur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentorum usum spatio propinquitatis interire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque tenebat Nox medium caeli spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi medio in spatio chorus Occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidium fere spatium confecerat, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium discrimina fallit,</quote> <trans><tr>the distance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 577</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum spatium victi considerat hostis (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris Et colli, ov. M. 2, 672: dat spatium collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:ib. 3:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve lateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:503" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 503</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sit homini spatium a vestigio ad verticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 17, 17, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium admirabile rhombi,</quote> <trans><tr>very large</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasti corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 806"
