default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: trahit aures in spatium, <hi rend="ital">in length</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lengthens them out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 176</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 197</bibl></cit>; 7, 783; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:562" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 562</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.6" n="2" level="3"> An open space for walking, racing, etc., in. </sense><sense id="n44903.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promenade; a public place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">square</hi>, etc. (cf. ambulatio): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs delubris distincta spatiisque communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templaque et innumeris spatia interstincta columnis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>colonnades</tr>, <tr>porticos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin igitur ad illa spatia nostra sedesque pergimus, ubi cum satis erit deambulatum, requiescemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia silvestria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator ex Academiae spatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit> (quoted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 23</bibl>, and by <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Academiae non sine causā nobilitata spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: locus planis Porrectus spatiis, <hi rend="ital">in level spaces</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">plains</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille actus habenā Curvatis fertur spatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 381</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A race-course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut fortis equus, spatio qui saepe supremo Vicit Olympia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:18:22" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero velim quasi decurso spatio a calce ad carceres revocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amat spatiis obstantia rumpere claustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum carceribus sese effudere quadrigae, Addunt in spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 513</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ad Elei metas et maxuma campi Sudabit spatia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 202</bibl></cit>: signoque repente Corripiunt spatia <pb n="1736" /> <cb n="SPAT" /> audito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 316</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritumque relinquunt Quadrijugi spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equi Pulsabant pedibus spatium declivis Olympi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstulere me velut de spatio Graeciae res immixtae Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis equos cursus et spatia probant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.9" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">room</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space in a building</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocus in interius spatium pulchrosque recessus Cecropidas ducit,</quote> <trans><tr>the inner space</tr>, <tr>the interior</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.10" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the action of walking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promenade; a turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in ambulationem ventum esset, Scaevolam, duobus spatiis tribusve factis, dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si interdum ad forum deducimur, si uno basilicae spatio honestamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem spatiis circo meruere coronam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agitatores) septimo spatio palmae appropinquant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44903.12" n="A" level="2"> Of time. </sense><sense id="n44903.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a space of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia omnis temporis non numero dierum sed noctium finiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium praeteriti temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum fuit diei spatium,</quote> <trans><tr>as the portion of the day allowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum, menstruum, diurnum, nocturnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum triginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo dilexit spatio Minoida Theseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 43</bibl></cit> (3, 19, 27): <cit><quote lang="la">spatio brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in brevi spatio mutantur secla animantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 77</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in brevi spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid longo spatio tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ex comparato et constituto spatio defensionis in semihorae curriculum coëgisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc interim spatio conclave illud concidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium juventae Transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa dies ... incerti spatium mihi finiat aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:874" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post sexagesimum vitae spatium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after the sixtieth year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44903.15" n="a" level="4"> Of a portion of time in which to do any thing, <hi rend="ital">space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, ut celari posset, tempus spatium ullum dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi tempus et spatium datum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae suae spatium et consilio tempus dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque datum erat spatium solitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum spatii nobis datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus inane peto, requiem spatiumque furori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 433</bibl></cit>: ne properes, oro; <cit><quote lang="la">spatium pro munere posco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proin quicquid est, da tempus ac spatium tibi. Quod ratio non quit, saepe sanavit mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 2:129" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 2, 129</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: spatium (aliquid, nihil spatii, etc.) alicui faciendi or ad faciendum aliquid, <hi rend="ital">time to do a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve spatium'st perferundi quae minitas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Ne esset spatium cogitandi ad disturbandas nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam longum spatium amandi amicam tibi dedi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui spatium ad se colligendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scribendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila in hostes coniciendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fuit spatium ad contrahenda castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum erit spatium, utrumque praestabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spatium ad dicendum habuissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium sumamus ad cogitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex dies ad eam rem conficiendam spatii postulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix explicandi ordines spatium Etruscis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium Vitellianis datum refugiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium quidem tandem adparandis nuptiis, vocandi, sacruficandi dabitur paululum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44903.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A year</hi> of life: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam (morbos) post sexagesimum vitae spatium non accidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 170</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44903.17" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Metrical time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quantity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trochaeus, qui est eodem spatio quo choreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu sermo subsultet imparibus spatiis ac sonis, miscens longa brevibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:17 al" default="NO">11, 3, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44903.18" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">A path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eadem spatia quinque stellae dispari motu cursuque conficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi opu'st, decurso aetatis spatio, cum meis gerere bellum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope jam excurso spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te vero, mea quem spatiis propioribus aetas Insequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 275</bibl></cit>: deflexit<cb n="SPEC" />  jam aliquantulum de spatio curriculoque consuetudo majorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum simus in spatio Q. Hortensium ipsius vestigiis persecuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currenti spatium praemonstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede inoffenso spatium decurrere vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 398" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 398</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spatula: <entryFree id="n44904" type="main" key="spa^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spăth-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spatha</etym>. * <sense id="n44904.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A broad piece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcina,</quote> <trans><tr>a leg of pork</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3:section=174" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3, § 174</bibl></cit> sqq.—* </sense><sense id="n44904.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little palmbranch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 23, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spatule: <entryFree id="n44905" type="greek" key="spa^tu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spătŭlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spata/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n44905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluptuousness</hi>: spatula eviravit omnes Venerivaga pueros, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
specialis: <entryFree id="n44906" type="main" key="spe^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>species</etym>, <sense id="n44906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi> (post-Aug. for singularis, proprius): <cit><quote lang="la">genera specialia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud generale ... hoc speciale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen speciale cognationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:20:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: quod speciale semper habuerunt, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, Treb. XXX. Tyr. 14.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕ-cĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specifically</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">singillatim, nominatim, proprie): generatim atque specialiter aliquid disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. generaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:58" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
specialitas: <entryFree id="n44907" type="main" key="spe^ci^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>specialis</etym>, <sense id="n44907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">particularity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiarity</hi>, Anton. Gramm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Diff. Verb. p. 2197" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Diff. Verb. p. 2197</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 25, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
specialiter: <entryFree id="n44908" type="main" key="spe^ci^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. specialis <sense id="n44908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
speciaria: <entryFree id="n44909" type="gloss" key="spe^ci^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>species</etym>, perh. <sense id="n44909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female spice-dealer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4302</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speciarius: <entryFree id="n44910" type="spur" key="spe^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></entryFree>
speciatim: <entryFree id="n44911" type="main" key="spe^ci^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>species</etym>, <sense id="n44911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specially</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">opp. generatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 939</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speciatus: <entryFree id="n44912" type="hapax" key="spe^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
species: <entryFree id="n44913" type="main" key="spe^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (<sense id="n44913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> specie or specii, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> were not in use in Cicero's time, but formarum, formis were used instead; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 30</bibl>.—At a later period were introduced: <cit><quote lang="la">specierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:section=151" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, § 151</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 18</bibl> P.; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 281</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">speciebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> ad Asclep. p. 92, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 9, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:29:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 29, § 10</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>specio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44913.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus): speciem quo vortimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 242</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 236</bibl> (for which, a little before, visus); 5, 707; 5, 724; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantis intervallis nostra species potest id animadvertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sensus nostros specie primā acerrime commovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui doloris speciem ferre non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, prop. that which is seen in a thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the outward appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exterior; shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mien</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn. forma). </sense><sense id="n44913.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter speciem stultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod speciem ac formam similem gerit ejus imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae species formaque pugnae, qui motus hominum non ita expictus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>outlines</tr>, <tr>contours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquem humanā specie et figurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis esse specie deos confitendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol specie lepida mulier!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellan' videtur specie mulier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis speciem vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">species praeclara oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaerae (Archimedeae), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nova atque inusitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro bene culto nihil potest esse specie ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum hominum species est honestissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad speciem magnifico ornatu,</quote> <trans><tr>as to outward appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla deformior species est civitatis, quam illa, in quā opulentissimi optimi putantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: speciem honesti habere, <hi rend="ital">the look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">semblance of what is right</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba majorem quam pro numero speciem ferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaces sunt rerum species, quibus credimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:34:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 34, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Something seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="SPEC" /> <hi rend="ital">spectacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponite itaque ante oculos miseram quidem illam ac flebilem speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit hanc speciem furiatā mente Coroebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 407</bibl></cit> (cf. I. supra).—</sense><sense id="n44913.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, that which is seen by the mind, <hi rend="ital">an idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>: hanc illi <foreign lang="greek">i)de/an</foreign> appellabant: <cit><quote lang="la">nos recte speciem possumus dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidebat in ejus mente species eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellentis eloquentiae speciem et formam adumbrabimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species, forma et notio viri boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prima sit haec forma et species et origo tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui species alias veri scelerisque capiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam non inanes species anxio animo figuraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44913.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>, etc. (opp. that which is real, actual, etc.). </sense><sense id="n44913.8" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">obiciuntur saepe formae, quae reapse nullae sunt, speciem autem offerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:37:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 37, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista securitas specie quidem blanda sed reapse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei species erat acceptio frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudi imponere aliquam speciem juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie liberā ... re verā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras inanis vanā specie libertatis adumbratas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 31, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimi ibi a fallaci equitum specie agasonibusque excepti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dux primam speciem adpropinquantis terroris sustinuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 6, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (nomina) primā specie admirationem, re explicatā risum movent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam humanitatis habent primam speciem ut misericordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinem quandam speciemque sapientium gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si speciem utilitatis voluptas habere dicetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33, 120</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n44913.9" n="b" level="4"> Esp. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of that which is assumed or pretended, <hi rend="ital">under pretext of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under pretence of</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n44913.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis viros specie quādam virtutis adsimulatae tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub specie tutelae liberūm ejus invasisse regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:21" default="NO">10, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 24, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44913.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per speciem celebrandarum cantu epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per speciem auxilii Byzantiis ferendi, re ipsā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 35, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:8" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 52, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.13" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis in speciem refectionis (viae) deteriorem viam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: in speciem, <hi rend="ital">for a show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a pretence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubio in speciem consensu fit ad Poenos deditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilatā in speciem actione, re ipsā sublatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad speciem tabernaculis relictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Cic. Pet. Cons. 5:18 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Cic. Pet. Cons. 5, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44913.14" n="2" level="3"> Also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: in speciem, <hi rend="ital">after the manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi> (cf. tamquam; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inque chori ludunt speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montis speciem curvari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:509" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 509</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpiones vermiculos ovorum specie pariunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.15" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas, venustas): ut in usum boni sint et in speciem populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit pompa, fuit species, fuit incessus saltem Seplasiā dignus et Capuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere quandam in dicendo speciem atque pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem candoremque caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie et motu capere homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumpho praebere speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortunatum species et gratia praestat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducit te species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem Saturnia vaccae probat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:310" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.16" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44913.17" n="1" level="3"> Concr. (for simulacrum, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwgon</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n44913.18" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An appearance in sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetit quietis Ipsa suae speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce suā specieque viri turbata soporem Excutit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:677" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quiete utrique consuli eadem dicitur visa species viri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nocturnas species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabundi velut ad somni vanam speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 32, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:394" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.19" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>: tum species ex aere vetus concidit ... Et divum simulacra peremit fulminis ardor ... Sancta Jovis species ... Haec tardata diu species tandem celsā in sede locata, Cic. poët. Div. 1, <pb n="1737" /> <cb n="SPEC" /> 12, 21.—</sense><sense id="n44913.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Reputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o speciem dignitatemque populi Romani, quam reges pertimescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 33, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.21" n="3" level="3"> The particular thing among many to which the looks are turned; hence, <hi rend="ital">a particular sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species pars est generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. p. 78, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum singula genera minimum in binas species dividi possunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus est id, quod sui similes communione quādam, specie autem differentes, duas aut plures complectitur partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum illud genus quaerimus, ex quo ceterae species suspensae sunt ... Homo species est, ut Aristoteles ait, canis species: commune his vinculum animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 10, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:2" default="NO">3, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:90 al" default="NO">5, 10, 90 al.</bibl>: codicillis multas species vestis, argenti specialiter reliquit, <hi rend="ital">many kinds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.22" n="b" level="4"> In later jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a special case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponitur apud eum species talis: Sutor puero discenti cervicem percussit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:85" default="NO">31, 1, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44913.23" n="c" level="4"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">goods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wares</hi> (that are classed together; cf. assortment); <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendenda sit species,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">spices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drugs</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
specillatus: <entryFree id="n44914" type="hapax" key="spe^cilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcillātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>specillum, <lbl>dim.</lbl> of speculum</etym>, <sense id="n44914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with little mirrors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patina argentea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
specillum: <entryFree id="n44915" type="main" key="spe^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>specio</etym>, <sense id="n44915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgical instrument for examining diseased parts of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a probe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:75" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 24, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
specimen: <entryFree id="n44916" type="main" key="spe^ci^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, that by which a thing is seen, known, or recognized. <sense id="n44916.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi> (class.; used only in <number>sing.</number>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum, exemplar): nunc specimen specitur, nunc certamen cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Specimen cernitur, quo eveniat aedificatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc specimen verum esse videtur, Quam celeri motu rerum simulacra ferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii specimen est quoddam transilire ante pedes posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii, ingenui hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Pis. 1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Pis. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:188" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 50, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximium consilii specimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anticum specimen animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solis avi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus Tale dabit specimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris Horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:57" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specimen dare alicui in aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish proof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae fidei specimen gentibus dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 58, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 36, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad specimen virtutis ostendendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44916.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ideal</hi> (so a favorite word with Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">specimen sationis et insitionis origo Ipsa fuit Natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1361</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">specimen humanitatis, salis, suavitatis, leporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantiae prudentiaeque specimen est Q. Scaevola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 39, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ordo ceteris specimen esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num dubitas, quin specimen naturae capi deceat ex optumā quāque naturā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicum antiquitatis specimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44916.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquum imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 223" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi specimen gloriosum arrogaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
specio: <entryFree id="n44917" type="main" key="spe^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭcĭo</orth>, <sense id="n44917.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>spexi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. spac-, see; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ske/p-tomai, skopo/s</foreign>; Lat.: specto, speculum, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi> (ante-class.): quod nos cum praepositione dicimus aspicio apud veteres sine praepositione spicio dicebatur, Fest. s. v. auspicium, p. 2 Müll.: spectare dictum ab specio antiquo, quo etiam Ennius usus: vos epulo postquam spexit, et quod in auspiciis distributum est, qui habent spectionem, qui non habeant; <cit><quote lang="la">et quod in auguriis etiam nunc augures dicunt avem specere ... Speculum, quod in eo specimus imaginem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 82</bibl></cit> Müll. (Vahl. has restored the verse of Ennius, Ann. 402, in this way: quos ubi rex populos spexit de cantibus celsis; cf. infra, Fest. <cb n="SPEC" /> p. 330 Müll.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam avim de templo Anchisa spexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicit quoque sine praepositione dixerunt antiqui. Plautus (Mil. 3, 1, 100): flagitium est, si nihil mittetur, quo supercilio spicit. Et spexit, Ennius, l. VI.: quos ubi rex ... spexit de montibu' celsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ib. s. v. spiciunt, p. 344: nunc specimen specitur, nunc certamen cernitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mihi credis, spece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speciose: <entryFree id="n44918" type="main" key="spe^ci^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. speciosus <sense id="n44918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
speciositas: <entryFree id="n44919" type="main" key="spe^ci^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>speciosus</etym>, <sense id="n44919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good looks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">naturalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Isaac, 7, § 60 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speciosus: <entryFree id="n44920" type="main" key="spe^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>species</etym> (acc. to species, II. B. 3.), <sense id="n44920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good-looking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period; syn.: venustus, pulcher, formosus, spectabilis). </sense><sense id="n44920.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (not so in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc speciosum pelle decorā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec id speciosum fieri putabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in certaminibus speciosa atque robusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:111:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 111, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam nemo speciosiorem producit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si plenior aliquis et speciosior et coloratior factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (Alcibiades),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44920.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reversionis has speciosas causas habes,</quote> <trans><tr>well-sounding</tr>, <tr>plausible</tr>, <tr>specious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specioso titulo uti vos, Romani, Graecarum civitatium liberandarum video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictu speciosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerentis bellum Romanos speciosum Graeciae liberandae tulisse titulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 17, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis necessarium quam speciosum, ministerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquod speciosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosum dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosa locis morataque recte Fabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosa nomina culpae Imponis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specioso eripe damno,</quote> <trans><tr>from this splendid misery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 133</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum speciosius quid dicendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosior rhetorice quam dialectice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosiore stili genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestarum rerum ordinem sequi speciosius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe speciosissimum genus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 49</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">showily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsomely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44920.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vehi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a painted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ornamented vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosius instratus equus quam uxor vestita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractet arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo speciosius ingrediantur sublimes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contorta hasta (with optime emissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44920.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectabilis: <entryFree id="n44921" type="main" key="specta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>specto</etym>. <sense id="n44921.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that may be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit> (al. aspectabile); so, <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus ab arboribus, spectabilis undique campus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 709</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44921.1" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">that is worth seeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Niobe Vestibus intexto Phrygiis spectabilis auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sit roseo spectabilis ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:705" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:496" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons topiario naturae opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">texenda spectabili subtilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchra et spectabilis victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater spectabile tela duxit opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:429" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44921.2" n="B" level="2"> Under the emperors: Spectabilis, <hi rend="ital">a title of high officers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud virum Spectabilem proconsulem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 62, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus vigilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectabilitas: <entryFree id="n44922" type="main" key="specta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spectabilis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n44922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of a</hi> Spectabilis (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 26, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
spectaculum: <entryFree id="n44923" type="main" key="specta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectācŭlum</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">spectāclum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 21 and 56), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>specto</etym>, <sense id="n44923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectacle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44923.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepidum spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superarum rerum atque caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis terque mutatae dapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius quam hoc spectaculum viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 38, 103</bibl></cit>: capere <cb n="SPEC" /> oblatae spectacula praedae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 246</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:780" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 780</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorti procacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hoc ista sibi tempus spectacula poscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaclum ipsa sedens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exposed to public view</tr>, <tr>in the sight of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc parentes Effugerit spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:102" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 102</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum (alicui) praebere, spectaculum (spectaculo) esse alicui: circuitus solis et lunae spectaculum hominibus praebent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 155</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebent spectacula capti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o spectaculum illud hominibus luctuosum, cedere e patriā servatorem ejus, manere in patriā perditores!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Corn. 1, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini non amico nostra incommoda spectaculo esse nolim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequitur acies ornata armataque, ut hostium quoque magnificum spectaculum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n44923.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44923.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in the theatre, circus, etc., <hi rend="ital">a public sight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stageplay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectacle</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munus, ludi, fabula): spectacula sunt tributim data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naumachiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum commisso spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interesse spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter matutina harenae spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meridianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44923.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the place whence plays are witnessed, <hi rend="ital">the seats of the spectators</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">places</hi> in the theatre, <hi rend="ital">the amphitheatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus spectaculis plausus est excitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resonant spectacula plausu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca divisa patribus equitibusque, ubi spectacula sibi quisque facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculorum gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculis detractus et in harenam deductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44923.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the theatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressum spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum trabibus spectacula textis surgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:23" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44923.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The spectators</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula tantum este, viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:556" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 556</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44923.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miracle</hi>: spectacula septem, <hi rend="ital">the seven wonders of the world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in septem spectaculis nominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerari inter septem omnium terrarum spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectamen: <entryFree id="n44924" type="main" key="specta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>specto</etym>. * <sense id="n44924.0" n="I" level="1"> = specimen, <hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectamen bono servo id est, Ut absente ero rem sui eri diligenter Tutetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44924.1" n="II" level="1"> = spectaculum, <hi rend="ital">a sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectacle</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">miserum funestumque spectamen aspexi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum et memorandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 193, 23.</sense></entryFree>
spectamenta: <entryFree id="n44925" type="gloss" key="specta_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectāmenta</orth> <itype>sunt quae spectantur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Diff. Voc. p. 2203" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Diff. Voc. p. 2203</bibl> P.</entryFree>
spectate: <entryFree id="n44926" type="main" key="specta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. specto <sense id="n44926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spectatio: <entryFree id="n44927" type="main" key="specta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>specto</etym>, <sense id="n44927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beholding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplation</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">a sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n44927.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44927.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: homo ad artificem suum (deum) spectat: quam spectationem Trismegistus <foreign lang="greek">qewri/an</foreign> rectissime nominavit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote
