lang="la">apparatūs spectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum levare spectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 44, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae scenicis moribus ad spectationes populo comparantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n44927.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an examining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testing</hi> of money: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78, § 181</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44927.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonicum bellum nomine amplius quam spectatione gentis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectativus: <entryFree id="n44928" type="main" key="specta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemplative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speculative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesin a causā sic distinguunt, ut illa sit spectativae partis, haec activae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opp. actualis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectator: <entryFree id="n44929" type="main" key="specta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looker-on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beholder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectator</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44929.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt homines quasi spectatores superarum rerum atque caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicus caeli siderumque (Ar chimedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis et spectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectator laudum tuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leuctricae calamitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certaminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 51, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44929.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44929.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A spectator</hi> in a theatre, at games, etc.: nunc, spectatores, clare plaudite,<pb n="1738" /> <cb n="SPEC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 3, 3</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 66; id. Cas. grex 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44929.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">critic</hi>: spectator probator, ut pecuniae spectatores dicuntur, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 18</bibl> (cf. specto, I. B. 3., and spectatio, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">elegans formarum spectator,</quote> <trans><tr>critic</tr>, <tr>connoisseur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprii ponderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectatrix: <entryFree id="n44930" type="main" key="specta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spectator</etym>. <sense id="n44930.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She that looks at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">observes</hi> a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44930.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She that judges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorrupta praeteritorum (posteritas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatrix dijudicatrixque omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectatus: <entryFree id="n44931" type="main" key="specta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of specto.</entryFree>
spectile: <entryFree id="n44932" type="main" key="specti^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectĭle</orth>, v. spetile.</entryFree>
spectio: <entryFree id="n44933" type="main" key="specti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>specio</etym>, in the lang. of augurs, <sense id="n44933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an observing of the auspices;</hi> hence, also, <hi rend="ital">the right of observing them</hi> (which belonged to the magistrates), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 82</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl>; Fest. s. h. v. p. 333.</sense></entryFree>
specto: <entryFree id="n44934" type="main" key="specto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">specto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold; to gaze at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: adspicio, speculor, conspicor, contueor). </sense><sense id="n44934.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44934.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n44934.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum a speciendo, quod ibi se spectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=129" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 129</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">82 ib.: si vis videre ludos jucundissimos ... amores tuos si vis spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare aliquid et visere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taceas, me spectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illas spectas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ere, ne me spectes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes acervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaude quod spectant oculi te mille loquentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum modo me spectas oculis protervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 77: <cit><quote lang="la">spectari tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 774</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zoroaster primus siderum motus diligentissime spectasse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitus te sequor, Spectans quas tu res hoc ornatu geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specta quam arcte dormiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe tui, specto, si sint in litore passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl></cit> (19), 27.—</sense><sense id="n44934.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vise, specta tuo arbitratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Sosia, age me huc aspice. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Specto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis specto, minus placet mihi hominis facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo spectante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare ad carceris oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:102" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso huc ad me specta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 149</bibl></cit>; so, ad me, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus, quae spectat in nos solos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego limis specto Sic per flabellum clanculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo hic spectabit, eo tu spectato simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">final clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plausu congregari feros (pisces) ad cibum assuetudine, in quibusdam vivariis spectetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 89, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectandum ne quoi anulum det,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectet currere Gangem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 629" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minaces ire per caelum faces specta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 325</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44934.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">see</hi> (a play or an actor) as a spectator, <hi rend="ital">to look on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Megalesia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circenses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices saltationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectavi ego pridem Comicos ad istum modum Sapienter dicta dicere atque is plaudier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae tacitae spectent, tacitae rideant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hic deludetur (Amphitruo), spectatores, vobis spectantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> prol. 151. —Hence, very often in inscrr. and tesseris: GLADIATORIIS SP., i. e. spectatus, of a gladiator <hi rend="ital">who had stood the first public fight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2561 sq.</bibl>; cf.: Morcelli delle tessere degli spettacoli Roma, Becker, Antiq. 4, p. 562.—</sense><sense id="n44934.9" n="2" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">to look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be situated</hi> towards any quarter (syn.: prospicio, vergo); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, etc., or an <hi rend="ital">adv. of place;</hi> less freq. <cb n="SPEC" /> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hujus insulae) alter angulus ad orientem solem, inferior ad meridiem spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad orientem solem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager, qui in ventum Favonium spectet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem ... in Etruriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also infra: Aquitania spectat inter occasum solis et septentriones,</quote> <trans><tr>is situated to the north - west</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quare fit, ut introversus et ad te Spectent atque ferant vestigia se omnia prorsus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 402, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ora eorum deorsum spectent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia Omnia te adversum spectantia, nulla retrorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (villae) spectent porticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: Creta altior est, quā spectat orientem, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 23</bibl> (H. 3, 58 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">Acarnania solem occidentem et mare Siculum spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediterranea regio est, orientem spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 25, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae et Tanaim et Bactra spectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo latere, quo (Gadis) Hispaniam spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of nations: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgae spectant in septentriones et orientem solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masaesyli in regionem Hispaniae spectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(argentum) dare spectandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fulvum spectatur in ignibus aurum, Tempore sic duro est inspicienda fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pecuniā non movetur ... hunc igni spectatum arbitrantur,</quote> <trans><tr>as having stood the test of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. spectatio, I. B., and spectator, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n44934.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44934.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">specta rem modo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam meretricum specta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunitatem spectate aniculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suave, E terrā magnum alterius spectare laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: caeli signorum admirabilem ordinem spectat, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 402, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te unum omnis mea spectat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44934.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look to</hi> a thing, as to an end or guide of action; hence, <hi rend="ital">to have in view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear in mind; to aim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">endeavor after; to meditate; to tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">have regard to</hi> a thing (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: contendo, pertineo, tendo): juvenes magna spectare et ad ea rectis studiis debent contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec commune bonum poterant spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:958" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 958</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem, non hominem, spectari oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil spectat nisi fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius statuisse videtur, quid vos in judicando spectare oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ea, quae sunt in usu vitāque communi, non ea quae finguntur aut optantur spectare debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti consensu defectionem omnes spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma et bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani, desperatā ope humanā, fata et deos spectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 16, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus quae spectat in nos solos,</quote> <trans><tr>relies on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in philosophiā res spectatur, non verba penduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>; so (with sequi) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum probandae virtutis tuae spectas?</quote> <trans><tr>do you seek?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli spectare, quanti homo sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me spectasse semper, ut tibi possem quam maxime esse conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad imperatorias laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suam magis gloriam quam ad salutem rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vitulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plebes Nolana de integro ad defectionem spectaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab scelere ad aliud spectare mulier scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 56, 10</bibl>.—Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">et prima et media verba spectare debent ad ultimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma rem spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad seditionem spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vim spectare res coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad perniciem patriae res spectabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid anquirunt, quod spectet et valeat ad bene beateque vivendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea non tam ad religionem spectant, quam ad jus sepulcrorum,</quote> <trans><tr>belong to</tr>, <tr>concern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam de eo genere beneficiorum dictum est, quae ad singulos spectant: deinceps de iis, quae ad universos pertinent, disputandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 7</bibl>: artem negabat esse ullam, nisi quae cognitis<cb n="SPEC" />  et in unum exitum spectantibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra consilia sempiternum tempus spectare debent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvendi necessitas debitorem spectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eo spectat, ut eā poenā non videamini esse contenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc eo spectabat, ut eam (Pythiam) a Philippo corruptam diceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: summa judicii mei spectat huc, ut meorum injurias ferre possim, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo igitur haec spectat oratio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorsum haec omnis spectat oratio?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia quicquid ad corpus spectat, et immortalitatis est expers, vanum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44934.15" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To judge of; to try</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi> (syn. probo): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo illum ex trunco corporis spectabat, sed ex artificio comico aestimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus animum ex animo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur ex singulis vocibus philosophi spectandi sunt, sed ex perpetuitate atque constantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex meo otium tuum specto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego non tam fastidiose in nobis quam in histrionibus spectari puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi facillime spectatur mulier, quae ingenio'st bono?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem in dubiis periclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium a deteriore parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B. 2.). </sense><sense id="n44934.16" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proved</hi> (syn.: probatus, cognitus): tuam probatam et spectatam maxime adulescentiam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 437, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines spectati et probati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides spectata et diu cognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas spectata per ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in rebus judicandis spectatus et cognitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectata ac nobilitata virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectata multis magnisque rebus singularis integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus spectata juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utebatur medico ignobili, sed spectato homine, Cleophanto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni virtus fidesque vestra spectata mihi forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cuique spectatissimum sit, quod occurrerit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>let that be the best test of each</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi satis spectatum est, Pompeium malle principem volentibus vobis esse quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 23</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n44934.17" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">looked up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecere tale ante alii spectati viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in perfecto et spectato viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non spectatior alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:440" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 440</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas clarissimi et spectatissimi viri atque in primis probati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatissima femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 147</bibl></cit>.—Of things (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">paeninsula spectatior (with flumen clarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatius artificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatissima laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 134</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spectātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatissime florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatissime ministrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spectrum: <entryFree id="n44935" type="main" key="spectrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>specio</etym>, <sense id="n44935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi> of a thing; <hi rend="ital">an apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectre</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwlon</foreign> (much less freq. than simulacrum and species): spectra Catiana ... nam quae Democritus <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwla</foreign>, Catius Insuber Epicureus spectra nominat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1 sq.</bibl>: spectra Catiana, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spectus: <entryFree id="n44936" type="hapax" key="spectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspect</hi>: spectu sine praepositione Pacuvius in Duloreste usus est, cum ait: spectu protervo ferox, Fest. s. h. v. p. 330 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Fragm. Trag. v. 147" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 147</bibl> Rib.</sense></entryFree>
specula: <entryFree id="n44937" type="main" key="spe^cu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44937.0" n="I" level="1"> A high place from which to look out, <hi rend="ital">a look-out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch-tower</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">specula, de quo prospicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 82</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">praedonum adventum significabat ignis e speculā sublatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat signum speculā ab altā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ex aliquā speculā prospexi tempestatem futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 23</bibl>' specularum significationem Sinon invenit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:547" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 547</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 69, 40.—* </sense><sense id="n44937.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a watchtower</hi>: stetit Caesar in illā amicitiae speculā,<pb n="1739" /> <cb n="SPEC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 86, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44937.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n44937.3" n="A" level="2"> In speculis esse, <hi rend="ital">to be on the watch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lookout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc homines in speculis sunt, observant, quemadmodum sese unusquisque vestrum gerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in speculis omnis Abydos erat, Ov. H. (17), 18, 12: in speculis atque insidiis relicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem unum in speculis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis paratas pendere in speculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 569</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44937.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like <foreign lang="greek">skopia/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a high place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in speculis summoque in vertice montis Planities ignota jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 526</bibl></cit>; so of the <hi rend="ital">summits</hi> of mountains, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 454</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">high walls</hi> of a city, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 877</bibl>; 4, 586.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44938" type="main" key="spe_cu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spes; cf. recula, from res</etym>, <sense id="n44938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight hope</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">estne quid in te speculae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulla nec specula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblectabar speculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassae speculae renuntias fortiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui speculā solabar clades ultimas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 253, 5.</sense></entryFree>
speculabilis: <entryFree id="n44939" type="hapax" key="spe^cu^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>speculor</etym>, <sense id="n44939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sunion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:624" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 624</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speculabundus: <entryFree id="n44940" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the look-out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the watch; watching for</hi> any thing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Festus Hadrumeto, ubi speculabundus substiterat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ostio speculabunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 112</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculabundus ex altissimā rupe identidem signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speculamen: <entryFree id="n44941" type="hapax" key="spe^cu^la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
specular: <entryFree id="n44942" type="main" key="spe^cu^lar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, v. specularis, II. <sense id="n44942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
specularis: <entryFree id="n44943" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>speculum</etym>. <sense id="n44943.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mirror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a mirror</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculari ratione,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner of a mirror</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44943.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">specularis lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of transparent stone</tr>, <tr>muscovy-glass</tr>, <tr>isinglass-stone</tr>, <tr>mica</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 150</bibl></cit> sqq.; 9, 35, 56, § 113; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 68</bibl>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">window panes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a window</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:86:11" default="NO">86, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 4</bibl> and 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 1 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">per corneum specular,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 53 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
specularius: <entryFree id="n44944" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlārĭus</orth> (contr. collat. form SPECLARIVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4284</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mirror-maker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>; Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6296</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Called also ‡ SPECVLARIARIVS (or contr. SPECLARIA),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6351 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
speculatio: <entryFree id="n44945" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>speculor</etym>. <sense id="n44945.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exploration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculationibus fidis doctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 2, 4</bibl>: turris speculationis, Greg. Mag. in Job, 31, 85.—</sense><sense id="n44945.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contemplation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speculation</hi>, Boëth. Consol. Phil. 4, 1; 5, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 326</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speculativus: <entryFree id="n44946" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speculative</hi> (late Lat.): philosophia, Boëth. ap. Porphyr. Dial. 1, p. 2.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = contemplativa (sc. philosophia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speculator: <entryFree id="n44947" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātor</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭcŭl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in milit. lang., <sense id="n44947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looker-out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">éclaireur</hi> (syn. explorator). </sense><sense id="n44947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculator, quem mittimus ante, ut respiciat quae volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 82</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:106:2" default="NO" valid="yes">106, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 2 al.</bibl>—These scouts formed a special division in each legion, Auct. B. Hisp. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3518 al.</bibl>—Under the emperors they were employed as special adjutants, messengers, and body-guards of a general, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 24</bibl> Lips.; 2, 11; 2, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 6, 27</bibl> (where the Greek has also <foreign lang="greek">spekoula/twr</foreign>) al. —</sense><sense id="n44947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a searcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicus, id est speculator venatorque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad has excipiendas voces speculator ex convivis Persei missus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7</bibl></cit>: Cleonis fuisse publice praepositos <foreign lang="greek">xalazofu/lakas</foreign>, speculatores futurae grandinis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 6, 1</bibl>: <cb n="SPEC" /> quo tu matutinus speculator amicae? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl> (3, 27), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">apes consumptis in proximo floribus speculatores ad pabula ulteriora mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius cautā speculator mente futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:679" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 679</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speculatorius: <entryFree id="n44948" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>speculator</etym>, <sense id="n44948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to spies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scouts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <trans><tr>spy-boats</tr>, <tr>vessels of observation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called speculatoriae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 42, 8</bibl>; and caliga, <hi rend="ital">worn by spies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scouts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n44948.1" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. navis.) <hi rend="ital">A spy-boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:36:42" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 36, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44948.2" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. caliga.) <hi rend="ital">A boot worn by spies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scouts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speculatrix: <entryFree id="n44949" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_tri_x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātrīx</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>speculor</etym>, <sense id="n44949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that spies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">watches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watcher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44949.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: furiae deae sunt speculatrices, credo, et vindices facinorum et scelerum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens boni speculatrix consiliorum suorum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 67, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr. Plat. 2, p. 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasiis speculatrix Juno resedit rupibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:190" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SPECVLATRIX ET PROPVGNATRIX MEORVM PERICVLORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4859</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44949.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculatrix villa profundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that looks towards the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuosi maris alto e tumulo speculatrix statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.</sense></entryFree>
speculatus: <entryFree id="n44950" type="main" key="spe^cu^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of speculor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44951" type="hapax" key="spe^cu^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>speculum</etym>, <sense id="n44951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with mirrors</hi>: cubiculum, Gloss. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor.</sense></entryFree>
speculor: <entryFree id="n44952" type="main" key="spe^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [1. specula], <hi rend="ital">to spy out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specto, conspicio): quo mox furatum veniat, speculatur loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Quid hic speculare? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Nihil equidem speculor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia speculari et perscrutari ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum te oculi et aures speculabuntur atque custodient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rostra, id. fl. 24, 57: jam vacuo laetam (avem) caelo speculatus,</quote> <trans><tr>having caught sight of</tr>, <tr>descried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemissus speculatum Bocchi consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 108, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta factaque alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abditos ejus sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: eventum Bellovacorum, <hi rend="ital">to look for</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">await</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem incustoditam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitus et ortus signorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas et nubila caeli (apes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 477</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc speculabor, quid ibi agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut specularetur, quae in laevā parte suorum fortuna esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc hinc speculabor procul, Unde advenienti sarcinam imponam seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 82</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculabor, ne quis hinc venator assit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad se venirent? an speculandi causā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculandi gratiā remissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudenter speculatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis sublime cacumen Occupat, unde sedens partes speculetur in omnes,</quote> <trans><tr>he can look around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 667</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speculum: <entryFree id="n44953" type="main" key="spe^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>specio; hence, that in which one sees himself</etym>. <sense id="n44953.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a looking-glass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mirror</hi> (usually made of polished metal): <cit><quote lang="la">speculum a speciendo, quod ibi se spectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=129" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 129</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum, quod in eo specimus imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">82: homines sibi habere speculum, ubi os contemplarent suom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opu'st speculo tibi, quae tute speculo speculum es maximum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculi imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 279</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculis apparent simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculorum levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens te in speculo videris alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in speculo rugas aspexit aniles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in speculo contemplari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 283, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava specula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 284, 2 et saep.— On the material and use of mirrors, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:160" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 17, 48, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:64" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 16, § 64</bibl>; 37, 7, 25, § 97; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tanquam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inspicere, tamquam in speculum, in vitas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 29, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44953.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of the mirror-like smoothness of water: <cit><quote lang="la">lympharum in speculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44953.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mirror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitation</hi> (rare; more freq. connected<cb n="SPER" />  with tamquam or ut, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">futuri temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 974</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:166" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes et bestias putat specula esse naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. with imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne opus Vergilianum de quodam Homerici operis speculo formatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
specus: <entryFree id="n44954" type="main" key="spe^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĕcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n44954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> specibus, Sen. Cons. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 125" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 125</bibl>; on the various forms found only in the grammarians, v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 569 sq.), <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen> and <gen>n.</gen> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>) [perh. root spec-; v. specio, and so orig. a hole, aperture; but cf. <foreign lang="greek">spe/os</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n44954.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">den; a cavity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasm</hi>, natural or artificial; of the latter kind, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered water-course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pit</hi> in mines, etc. (cf. spelunca). </sense><sense id="n44954.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> (class. and freq.): inferum vastos specus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 32</bibl> (Trag. v. 218 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">specus tenebricosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 222:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 222, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons ex opaco specu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum medium ferme specu vasto collapsum dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>; so <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 409</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4, 59</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos agor in specus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: paucos specus in extremo fundo, et eos quidem subterraneos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl>; so of <hi rend="ital">drains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ditches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 741 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 741 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44954.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): concava specus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 23</bibl> (Ann. v. 420 Vahl.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 568</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 2</bibl> Müll. (Trag. p. 91 Rib.); id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> Müll. (l. l. p. 73 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">specum quandam nactus remotam latebrosamque, in eam me penetro et recondo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 276</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44954.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hic specus horrendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 568</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Serv. ad loc.: invisum caelo specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:425" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 425</bibl></cit>; Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44954.5" n="(d)" level="5"> Acc. to the second declension: speca apposita, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 713</bibl> P.: altis claudere specis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 25</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 63 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n44954.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity</hi> of any kind (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">specus atri vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 700</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Capacis alvi mersit tartareo specu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a snake's belly,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 276</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the belly of the Trojan horse, Petr. poët. 89, 2, 7.— In mal. part.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 83, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spegma: <entryFree id="n44955" type="main" key="spegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spegma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, v. psegma.</entryFree>
spelaeum: <entryFree id="n44956" type="greek" key="spe_laeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēlaeum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spēlēum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sph/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n44956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">den</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose; syn. antrum): in silvis, inter spelaea ferarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 52</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spelaea metuenda ferarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptum millibus (ab Abraham),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Tetr. Vet. Test. 5</bibl></cit>: cum initiatur in spelaeo, Tert. Cor. Mil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">HOC SPELEVM CONSTITVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spelta: <entryFree id="n44957" type="main" key="spelta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spelta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spelt</hi>: totidem speltas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grains of spelt</hi>, Rhemn. Fann. Pond. 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 1, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spelunca: <entryFree id="n44958" type="greek" key="spe_lunca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēlunca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sph/lugc</foreign>, <sense id="n44958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">ggos</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n44958.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">den</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. specus): Philocteta jam decimum annum in speluncā jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 469</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 27: <cit><quote lang="la">pumice pendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:177 al" default="NO"><author>Val.
