Fl.</author> 4, 177 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44958.2" n="II" level="1"> Spelunca, <hi rend="ital">name of a country-seat of Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Terracina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
speluncosus: <entryFree id="n44959" type="hapax" key="spe_lunco_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēluncōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spelunca</etym>, <sense id="n44959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of caves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caverns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:191" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spera: <entryFree id="n44960" type="main" key="spe_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sphaera <sense id="n44960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sperabilis: <entryFree id="n44961" type="hapax" key="spe_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spērābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spero</etym>, <sense id="n44961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be hoped for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nulla vitae meae salus sperabilis't,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speratus: <entryFree id="n44962" type="main" key="spe_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of spero.</entryFree>
spercheos: <entryFree id="n44963" type="main" key="Sperche_os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchēos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchīus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-īos</orth>, v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 127 sq.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sperxei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n44963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising on Mount Pindus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Ellada;</hi> form -eos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 487</bibl>; Rib., Forb. (al. Sperchius); <cit><quote lang="la">form -eus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; 37, 4, 10; <cit><quote lang="la">form -ios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 23, § 28</bibl> (v. C. infra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 579</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form -ius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:838" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 838</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44963.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Spercheos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44963.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dweller by the Spercheos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 86</bibl>. <pb n="1740" /> <cb n="SPER" /> —</sense><sense id="n44963.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchiae</orth>, ārum <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sperchios</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 13, § 28</bibl> dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Jahn, Sparthos),</quote> <trans><tr>a town of Thessaly</tr>, <tr>on the Spercheos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
speres: <entryFree id="n44964" type="main" key="spe_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēres</orth>, v. spes <sense id="n44964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sperma: <entryFree id="n44965" type="greek" key="sperma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sperma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spe/rma</foreign>, <sense id="n44965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sperm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Hist. Sacr. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spermaticus: <entryFree id="n44966" type="greek" key="sperma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spermătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">spermatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spermatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18:180" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18, 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spernax: <entryFree id="n44967" type="main" key="spernax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spernax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sperno</etym>, <sense id="n44967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">despising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showing contempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemptuous</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">viri spernaces mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:465" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in admittendo consilio spernax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sperno: <entryFree id="n44968" type="main" key="sperno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sperno</orth>, <itype>sprēvi, sprētum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n44968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. sprērunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Dittoch. 31</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root spar-, to part; Sanscr. spar-itar, enemy; cf. Lat. parcus; Germ. sperren</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (syn.: segrego, separo; perh. only in the foll. passages): jus atque aequom se a malis spernit procul, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 399, 10</bibl> (Trag. v. 224 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc spes, opes auxiliaque a me segregant spernuntque se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille illas spernit segregatque ab se omnis extra te unam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n44968.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, subject., <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurn</hi> (the class. signif.; esp. freq. after the Aug. period; syn.: contemnere, despicere; pro nihilo putare, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. colere): meam speciem spernat (a little later: se contemnit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: spernitur orator bonus, horridus miles amatur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 273 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non respondit, nos sprevit et pro nihilo putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spernerentur ab iis, a quibus essent coli soliti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperni ab iis veteres amicitias, indulgeri novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me animo non spernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitemne sororem Sprevisti moriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam inimicus nomini Romano est, qui Ennii Medeam spernat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas auspiciorum spreta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigus et stultus donat quae spernit et odit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina deos spernens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia spretorum (deorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 63, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 40, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo quoque spretum consulis imperium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum vilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(genus orationis) spretum et pulsum foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haudquaquam spernendus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud spernendos falsi tituli testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque morum spernendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spernens dotis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec partem solido demere de die Spernit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequio deferri spernit aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spernor: <entryFree id="n44969" type="hapax" key="spernor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spernor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n44969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [sperno; cf. aspernor], <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Eloq. p. 227" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Eloq. p. 227</bibl></cit> Mail.</sense></entryFree>
spero: <entryFree id="n44970" type="main" key="spe_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n44970.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hope</hi> (something desirable), <hi rend="ital">to look for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect; to promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flatter one's self</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: confido, exspecto). </sense><sense id="n44970.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: spero, si speres quicquam prodesse potes sunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 410 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoad Pompeius in Italiā fuit, sperare non destiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque accusator timere neque reus sperare debuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubes bene sperare et bono esse animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attica nostra quid agat, scire cupio: etsi tuae litterae recte sperare jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu jam, ut spero et ut promittis, aderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia experiar et, ut spero, assequar ... Sed, ut spero, valebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi detis hanc veniam accommodatam huic reo, vobis, quemadmodum spero, non molestam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argyrippus exorari spero poterit, ut sinat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non usus veniet, spero. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Spero hercle ego quoque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea fiet aliquid, spero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: salvus sit; <cit><quote lang="la">spero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44970.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his omnibus victoriam sperantibus pacis nomen adferemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam sperabit a latronum gregibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: magis adversos rerum exitus metuens quam sperans<cb n="SPER" />  secundos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego et speraram prudentiā tuā fretus, et, ut confiderem, fecerunt tuae litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 18</bibl></cit>: a quo nihil speres boni rei publicae, quia non vult; <cit><quote lang="la">nihil metuas mali, quia non audet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo genere hominum victoriam sperasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ex victoriā et ex suā liberalitate sperarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (tormentis) ipsi magna speravissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero meliora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona alicuius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sperans, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperare victoriam ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: quod sapienter speravimus, perseveranter consectari, <hi rend="ital">have expected</hi>, Col. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">29: sperata gloria (opp. parta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 41, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperata praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem speratam quom optulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem optandam magis quam sperandam quam minimam posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum malis sperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam, regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem honestam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 58, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali poenam, Lact. de Ira, 16, 8: perpetuam felicitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat infestis, metuit secundis Alteram sortem bene praeparatum Pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata superveniat, quae non sperabitur hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: dis sum fretus, deos sperabimus, <hi rend="ital">we will hope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trust in the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 52</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44970.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (so most freq.; usually with <hi rend="ital">inf. fut.;</hi> less freq. but class. with <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>).—With <hi rend="ital">inf. fut.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me confido liberum fore, tu te numquam speras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:20:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 20, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus sperant se maximum fructum esse capturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod amicitiae nostrae memoriam spero sempiternam fore, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu fac animo forti magnoque sis, speresque fore, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spero fore, ut contingat id nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit> et saep.— With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istoc te speras modo Potesse dissimulando infectum hoc reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero me habere, qui hunc excruciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat se a me avellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius Galliae sese potiri posse sperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero, quae tua prudentia est, et hercule, ut me jubet Acastus, confido te jam, ut volumus, valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabam tuum adventum appropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speremus, nostrum nomen volitare et vagari latissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero te mihi ignoscere, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero esse, ut volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 6</bibl></cit> b, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ita quiddam spero nobis profici, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 2</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">speramus carmina fingi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 331</bibl></cit>: neque ego hanc abscondere furto Speravi, ne finge, fugam, <hi rend="ital">I did not hope</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 338</bibl>.—So esp. when used like Engl. <hi rend="ital">hope</hi>, in the sense <hi rend="ital">trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero nostram amicitiam non egere testibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id enim deos immortalis spero aequissimum judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speravi miser Ex servitute me exemisse filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ejus spero fratrem propemodum Jam repperisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabam jam defervisse adulescentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: spero tibi me causam probasse; <cit><quote lang="la">cupio quidem certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero cum Crassipede nos confecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tum mirifice sperabat se esse locutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperasse libertatem se civium suorum emisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabam ita notata me reliquisse genera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 7, 3</bibl>. —Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui semper vacuam, semper amabilem Sperat (sc. te fore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44970.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam, ut salvum vellent tyrannum, sperare non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patiatur ... nec sperandum ulli nec concupiscendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 18:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Polyb. 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>.—( ) In a Greek construction, with <hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visura et quamvis numquam speraret Ulixen, etc. (for se visuram esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit> Paley ad loc.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque de otio nostro spero jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>: de eo bene sperare (with <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>, cf. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44970.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehend</hi> that which is <cb n="SPES" /> undesired, <foreign lang="greek">e)lpi/zw</foreign> (rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. only with non, and ironically): nam quod tu speres, propulsabo facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non hoc miserae sperare jubebas, Sed conubia laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec merui sperare? dabis mihi, perfida, poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ego si potui tantum sperare dolorem, Et perferre, soror, potero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 419</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec adeo ex illo mihi jam speranda fuerunt Tempore, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mene efferre pedem, genitor, te posse relicto Sperasti?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 658</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si genus humanum et mortalia temnitis arma, At sperate deos memores fandi atque nefandi,</quote> <trans><tr>expect</tr>, <tr>fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinguine mea Speravi te posse manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:295" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquod in Africā bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam quartanam sperantibus aegris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—With a negative particle: <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Moneo ego te: te deseret ille aetate et satietate. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Non spero. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Insperata accidunt magis saepe quam quae speres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 40</bibl>: id quod non spero, Afran ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin a vobis, id quod non spero, deserar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: te tam mobili in me meosque esse animo non sperabam, Q. Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non speravi te sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:139" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 139</bibl></cit>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam haec satis spero vobis molesta videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 51</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">spērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that is hoped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longed for;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spērātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">spērāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lover; a bride</hi> (ante- and post-class.): curre et nuntia Venire me et mecum speratum adducere, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperata, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 97</bibl></cit>; so, sperata, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7:71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7, 71</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 31" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:33" default="NO">33</bibl>.—Once also of a wife not seen for a long time: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo uxorem salutat laetus speratam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spes: <entryFree id="n44971" type="main" key="spes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spes</orth>, <itype>spēi</itype> (<sense id="n44971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> spe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 7</bibl> dub.; Weissenb. spei; <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> and <case>acc.</case> speres, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 410 and 132 Vahl.; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sperum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Paneg. Const. 15</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> speribus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 27</bibl> and 30: <cit><quote lang="la">spebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Apollin. Ep. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 243</bibl>; Hilar. in Psa. 119; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 570), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root spa-, to draw out; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spa/w</foreign>; cf.: prosper, spondeo; v. spatium</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44971.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44971.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., the expectation of something desired, <hi rend="ital">hope</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn. exspectatio). </sense><sense id="n44971.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spes est exspectatio boni, mali exspectationem esse necesse est metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona spes cum omnium rerum desperatione confligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: ut aegroto, dum anima est, spes esse dicitur; <cit><quote lang="la">sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: nolite nimiam spem habere, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem habere in fide alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros tantum spei habere ad vivendum, quantum accepissent ab Antonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum est nec habere ne spei quidem extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quīs plurimum habebat spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem sibi aliquam proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem reliquorum in vestrā potestate positam esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem ponere in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: spem salvis in alicujus morte deponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem alicujus alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxerat meam spem, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in spem adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (salus nostra) spe exiguā extremāque pendet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos homines spes falleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā de spe decidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac spe lapsus Indutiomarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris militibus spem minuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii eā spe dejecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac spe repulsi Nervii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de spe conatuque depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro re certā spem falsam domum retulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum spe, sed certā re jam et possessione deturbatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei nostrae finem inponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morando spem destituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor tantae ad inritum cadentis spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes ad inritum redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus, magnā spe depulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii ab ingenti spe destituti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā spe destituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: spem pro re <pb n="1741" /> <cb n="SPES" /> ferentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 40, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem sine re, sine fide, sine spe, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt omnia, sicut adulescentis, non tam re et maturitate quam spe et exspectatione laudata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 30, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jam aut rem aut ne spem quidem exspecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo umquam animo aut spe majora suscipiet, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praeter spem scio multis bona evenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praeter spem evenit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente praeter spem dixit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera contra spem salva invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia bona in spe habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sunt spes meae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi mulierculae essent salvae, spes aliquae forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo nostrae spes omnesque opes sitae Erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Catilinae spes atque opes concidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so often: spes opesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cadus) Spes donare novas largus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 19 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44971.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem istoc pacto nuptiarum omnem eripis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe mercedis adducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes dignitatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes diuturnitatis atque imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in praemiis humanis spem posueris rerum tuarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam me tui spem das,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni mihi esset spes ostensa Hujusce habendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes amplificandae fortunae fractior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reo audaci spem judicii corrumpendi praeciderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus a spe societatis Prusiae decidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc conloquium abstulit spem Hannibali recipiendae Nolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exulanti Amyandro spes recuperandi regni facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe templi capiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem suae mortis conceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 554</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44971.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes est, eum melius facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna me spes tenet, explicare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem maximam adducti, hunc ipsum annum salutarem civitati fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne spes quidem ulla ostenditur, fore melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam in spem veniebat, fore, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam se habere spem, Ariovistum finem injuriis facturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecta est spes patri, Posse illam extrudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui vestrum spe ducitur, se posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem venio, appropinquare tuum adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna me spes tenet, bene mihi evenire, quod mittar ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Aetolos legatum misit, magis ut nudaret animos, quam spe impetrari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a spe scalis capi urbem posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe castra eo die se oppugnaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 31, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44971.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae te ratio in istam spem induxit, ut eos tibi fidelis putaris fore?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spem afferunt, ut ... fructus appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes mihi certa fuit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritā spe agitari, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 26</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes est de argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de flumine transeundo spem se fefellisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam spem tunc ille de me concepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nato filio pater spem de illo quam optimam capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea vero quam vidi nostros tantum spei habere ad vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem habere ad ejus salutem exstinguendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallis ad temptanda ea defuit spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spei ad resistendum nihil esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 19, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44971.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44971.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The hope of being appointed heir</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">leniter in spem Arrepe officiosus, ut et scribare secundus Heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem secundam nepotes pronepotesque (assumebantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44971.9" n="b" level="4"> Spes, <hi rend="ital">a Roman divinity who had several temples in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 51, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl> (19); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 9</bibl>; cf. Hartung, Relig. d. Röm. 2, p. 264.—</sense><sense id="n44971.10" n="B" level="2"> Transf, concr., like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">hope</hi>, of that in which hope is placed, or which is hoped for (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n44971.11" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes, Spes vestri reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: vestras spes <cb n="SPHA" /> uritis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 672</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes o fidissima Teucrum (of Aeneas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem suam (i. e. exta) circumvolat alis (milvus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 719</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spe (i. e. re speratā) potitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:527" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 527</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44971.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of hopeful children, and, by analogy, of the young of animals, or of the fruits of the earth: <cit><quote lang="la">devovit nati spemque caputque parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 94</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf. also in <number>plur.</number>, of one child: <cit><quote lang="la">per spes surgentis Iuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 524</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 274</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuosne ego, o meae spes inanes, labentis oculis vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">12: (capella) gemellos, Spem gregis, silice in nudā connixa reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sus) quia semina pando Eruerit rostro spemque interceperit anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44971.13" n="b" level="4"> In gen., as a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">hope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o spes mea, o mea vita, o mea voluptas, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o salutis meae spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mea carissima filiola, et spes reliqua nostra, Cicero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44971.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An anticipation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apprehension</hi> of something not desired, <foreign lang="greek">e)lpi/s</foreign> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si meam spem vis improborum fefellerit atque superaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala res, spes multo asperior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus contra spem suam laetissimis animis excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 88, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (bellum) quidem spe omnium serius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium spe celerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in malā jam spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spe Hannibali fuit defectio Tarentinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum spes nulla necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:129" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragii spes omnis abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 455</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spetile: <entryFree id="n44972" type="gloss" key="spe_ti^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spētĭle</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spectĭle</orth>) <itype>vocatur infra umbilicum suis, quod est carnis, proprii cujusdam habitus, exos</itype>, quā etiam antiqui per se utebantur. Plautus enumerandis suillis obsoniis in Carbonaria sic: <sense id="n44972.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ego pernam, sumen sueris, spectile, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
speusippus: <entryFree id="n44973" type="main" key="Speusippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Speusippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*speu/sippos</foreign>, <sense id="n44973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nephew of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and his successor in the Academy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:67 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 67 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
speusticus: <entryFree id="n44974" type="greek" key="speusti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">speustĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">speustiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n44974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastily made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes, a kind of bread,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sphacos: <entryFree id="n44975" type="greek" key="spha^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphăcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfa/kos</foreign>. <sense id="n44975.0" n="I" level="1"> = sphagnos, <hi rend="ital">a kind of fragrant moss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 17, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44975.1" n="II" level="1"> = elelisphacos, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 71, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaera: <entryFree id="n44976" type="greek" key="sphaera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaera</orth> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sphēra</orth>; once <orth extent="full" lang="la">sphĕra</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 278</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfai=ra</foreign>, <sense id="n44976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sphere</hi> (pure Lat. globus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n44976.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeras pugnum altas facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habent suam sphaeram stellae inerrantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44976.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44976.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A globe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sphere</hi> made to represent the heavenly bodies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44976.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A globe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the great bodies of the universe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 741</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44976.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A ball</hi> for playing with (syn. follis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:88" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:11:134" default="NO">5, 11, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 14, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the hand of a statue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaeralis: <entryFree id="n44977" type="main" key="sphaera_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sphaera</etym>, <sense id="n44977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaericus: <entryFree id="n44978" type="greek" key="sphaeri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: numeri, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 2, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">spherics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the science of heavenly motions</hi>, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 1, 1, p. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaerion: <entryFree id="n44979" type="greek" key="sphaeri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n44979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pill</hi> in medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaerista: <entryFree id="n44980" type="greek" key="sphaerista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ball-player</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaeristerium: <entryFree id="n44981" type="greek" key="sphaeriste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaeristērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairisth/rion</foreign>. <sense id="n44981.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place for playing ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ball-court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tennis-court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 57</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44981.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a game at ball</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sphaeroides: <entryFree id="n44982" type="greek" key="sphaero^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spherical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">schema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sphaeromachia: <entryFree id="n44983" type="greek" key="sphaero^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfairomaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n44983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of boxing in which the combatants<cb n="SPIC" />  had iron balls strapped to their hands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4</bibl>, praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sphaerula: <entryFree id="n44984" type="main" key="sphaeru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphaerŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sphaera</etym>, <sense id="n44984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sphere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. Lit. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. Lit. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphaerus: <entryFree id="n44985" type="main" key="Sphaerus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sphaerus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sfai=ros</foreign>. <sense id="n44985.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Zeno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44985.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphagiae: <entryFree id="n44986" type="main" key="Spha^gi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sphăgĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three rocky islands near Pylos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphagnos: <entryFree id="n44987" type="greek" key="sphagnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphagnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfa/gnos</foreign>, <sense id="n44987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fragrant moss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 50, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 17, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphincter: <entryFree id="n44988" type="greek" key="sphincter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphincter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfigkth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n44988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sphincter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the muscle of the anus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphinga: <entryFree id="n44989" type="main" key="Sphinga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sphinga</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Spin-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Sphinx (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 13.—<sense id="n44989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 67" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 2, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphingatus: <entryFree id="n44990" type="main" key="sphinga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphingātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sphinga</etym>, <sense id="n44990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a sphinx</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphingion: <entryFree id="n44991" type="greek" key="sphingi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphingĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfiggi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n44991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ape</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the dog-headed ape</hi>: Simia cynocephalus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 72, 93, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphinthria: <entryFree id="n44992" type="main" key="sphinthri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphinthrĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spintrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">sfigkth/r</foreign>, the contractile muscle of the anus</etym>, <sense id="n44992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sphinx: <entryFree id="n44993" type="main" key="Sphinx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sphinx</orth>, <itype>ngis</itype> (Gr. <sense id="n44993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Sphingos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 66</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sfi/gc</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n44993.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fabulous monster near Thebes that used to propose riddles to travellers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and tear in pieces those who could not solve them;</hi> usually represented with the head of a woman and the body of a lion, afterwards also with the wings of a bird; <cit><quote lang="la">or, also, with the head of a man and the body of a lion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 77</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 67 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 67 al.</bibl>—Augustus had the figure of a sphinx upon his seal, as a symbol of silence, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 4, § 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes formati in speciem sphingum, Fest. s. v. picati, p. 206.— In a lusus verbb.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44993.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of ape</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the chimpanzee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sphondyle: <entryFree id="n44994" type="main" key="sphondy^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphondylē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sphondylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sphondylĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, v. spond-.</entryFree>
sphragis: <entryFree id="n44995" type="greek" key="sphra_gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphrāgis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfragi/s</foreign> (a seal). <sense id="n44995.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of stone used for seals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44995.1" n="II" level="1"> Another name for <hi rend="ital">Lemnian earth</hi>, so called because sold in sealed packets, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 14, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44995.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little ball of plaster</hi> in medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl> (5, 20, 2, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
sphragitis: <entryFree id="n44996" type="greek" key="sphra_gi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphrāgītis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfragi=tes</foreign>, <sense id="n44996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the impression of a seal</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1076.</sense></entryFree>
sphyraena: <entryFree id="n44997" type="greek" key="sphy_raena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sphȳraena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sfu/raina</foreign>, <sense id="n44997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> sudis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spica: <entryFree id="n44998" type="main" key="spi_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (vulg. <orth extent="full" lang="la">spēca</orth>: <sense id="n44998.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">rustici, ut acceperunt antiquitus, vocant specam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">spī-cum</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 29</bibl>; Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 110.—<hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcus</orth>, Poët. ap.
