Fest. s. v. spicum, p. 333 Müll.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root spi-, to be sharp; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spi/los</foreign>, rock; <foreign lang="greek">spino/s</foreign>, lean</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44998.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a point;</hi> hence, in partic., of grain, <hi rend="ital">an ear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spike</hi> (syn. arista), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:63:2" default="NO">1, 63, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 19, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem in spicis intercipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 689</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distendet spicis horrea plena Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicas hordaceas gerenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">his qui contentus non est, in litus harenas, In segetem spicas, in mare fundat aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44998.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a similar shape. </sense><sense id="n44998.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tuft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi> of other plants, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 23, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:161" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 79, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44998.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The brightest star in the constellation</hi> Virgo, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 110; <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:65" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 311</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 269</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44998.5" n="C" level="2"> Spica testacea, <hi rend="ital">a kind of brick for pavements</hi>, laid so as to imitate the setting of the grains in an ear of corn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. spicatus, under spico.—</sense><sense id="n44998.6" n="D" level="2"> Spicus crinalis, <hi rend="ital">a hair-pin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 903</bibl> (al. spicum crinale, al. crinale spiclum; but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 198</bibl>, the better reading is spiritus acer, v. Lachm. ad h. l.). <pb n="1742" /> <cb n="SPIN" /></sense></entryFree>
spicatus: <entryFree id="n44999" type="main" key="spi_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. spico.</entryFree>
spiceus: <entryFree id="n45000" type="main" key="spi_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spica</etym>, <sense id="n45000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of ears of corn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit> (24); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; Sabin. Massur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of grain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frux, Aus. Monos. de Cibis: coma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
spicifer: <entryFree id="n45001" type="main" key="spi_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spica-fero</etym>, <sense id="n45001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ear-bearing</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Ceres, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 598" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 598</bibl>.—Of the Nile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:403" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 403</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spicilegium: <entryFree id="n45002" type="main" key="spi_ci^le^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcĭlĕgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>spica-lego</etym>, <sense id="n45002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gleaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leasing</hi> of ears of corn after gathering (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">messi facta spicilegium venire oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 7, § 109</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
spicio: <entryFree id="n45003" type="main" key="spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. specio.</entryFree>
spiclum: <entryFree id="n45004" type="main" key="spiclum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spiclum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. spiculum.</entryFree>
spico: <entryFree id="n45005" type="main" key="spi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīco</orth>, no <sense id="n45005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spica</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with spikes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ears</hi> (post-Aug., and usually in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): grana in stipulā crinito textu spicantur, <hi rend="ital">shoot out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put forth ears</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaecissos spicata est tritici modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 84, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum spicatarum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 17, 61, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testacea spicata,</quote> <trans><tr>a pavement of bricks</tr>, <tr>laid in the shape of ears of corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam longa exigui spicant hastilia dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>sharpen to a point</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicatae faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 484</bibl></cit>: animantes spicatae aculeis, Min. Octav. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spicula: <entryFree id="n45006" type="main" key="spi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chamaepitys, <hi rend="ital">ground-pine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiculator: <entryFree id="n45007" type="main" key="spi_cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcŭlātor</orth>, v. speculator.</entryFree>
spiculo: <entryFree id="n45008" type="main" key="spi_cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spiculum</etym>, <sense id="n45008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sharpen to a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to point</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mantichorae cauda spiculata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, § 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spiculum: <entryFree id="n45009" type="main" key="spi_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcŭlum</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīclum</orth>, perh. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 903</bibl>, or p. 306 Grot., where, however, Kopp and others read spicum; v. spica, II. D.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spicum</etym>, <sense id="n45009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sharp point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sting</hi> (syn.: mucro, acus, aculeus). </sense><sense id="n45009.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45009.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 237</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 74</bibl>.—Of a scorpion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:542" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 542</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(scorpio) solus (insectorum) habet in caudā spiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl></cit>. —Of hornets, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 335</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosarum spicula,</quote> <trans><tr>thorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45009.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the point</hi> of a missile weapon (as a dart, arrow, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">Epaminondas tum denique sibi avelli jubet spiculum, posteaquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:2" default="NO">5, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastarum spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipalme spiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calami spicula Gnosii Vitabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Crassus spiculis prope scrutatus est Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula sagittae,</quote> <trans><tr>barbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>, n. 2.—</sense><sense id="n45009.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a dart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrow</hi> (syn. jaculum): <cit><quote lang="la">Laoedaemonii suos omnes agros esse dictitarunt, quos spiculo possent attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 687</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">an arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 497</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 601</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 606</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:133" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:273" default="NO">3, 273</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 115, § 141</bibl>; of Cupid's <hi rend="ital">arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl> (3, 4), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:708 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 708 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">a later name for the</hi> pilum: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pilum vocabant, nunc spiculum dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: solis, <hi rend="ital">a ray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beam of the sun</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiculus: <entryFree id="n45010" type="hapax" key="spi_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spiculum</etym>, <sense id="n45010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non lucernae spiculo lumine opus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
spicum: <entryFree id="n45011" type="main" key="spi_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. spica <sense id="n45011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spina: <entryFree id="n45012" type="main" key="spi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root spī, whence also spicna, spīca, spinus</etym>, <sense id="n45012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45012.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lubrica serpens Exuit in spinis vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consertum tegumen spinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 594</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl>. —Of particular kinds of thorny plants or shrubs: <cit><quote lang="la">solstitialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba,</quote> <trans><tr>whitethorn</tr>, <tr>hawthorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:6" default="NO">7, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO">3, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:108" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 12, 66, § 108</bibl>: Aegyptia, <hi rend="ital">the Egyptian blackthorn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sloe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 20, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:107" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 12, 65, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabica,</quote> <trans><tr>Arabian acacia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 65, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a like shape. </sense><sense id="n45012.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A prickle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spine</hi> of certain animals (as the hedgehog, sea-urchin, etc.): animantium <cb n="SPIN" /> aliae coriis tectae sunt, aliae villis vestitae, aliae spinis hirsutae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hystrices spinā contectae (with aculei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 35, 53, § 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:182" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 59, 85, § 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinā nocuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:130" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fish-bone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus spinis cooperta piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 244</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The backbone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput spina excipit: ea constat ex vertebris quattuor et viginti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:29:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 806</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorsi spina, Aug. Civ. Dei, 19, 4, n. 2: spina quae est in dorso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 380</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 672</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.6" n="4" level="3"> Spina, <hi rend="ital">a low wall dividing the circus lengthwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around which was the race-course; the barrier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 51</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:588" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 588</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A toothpick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45012.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n45012.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thorns</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">difficulties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtleties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexities</hi> in speaking and debating (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">disserendi spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partiendi et definiendi,</quote> <trans><tr>subtleties</tr>, <tr>intricacies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum more non spinas vellentium, ut Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cares</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certemus, spinas animone ego fortius an tu Evellas agro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45012.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Errors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te exemta juvat spinis de pluribus una,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spinalis: <entryFree id="n45013" type="main" key="spi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spina, I. B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n45013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the spine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spinal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl></cit>, §§ 22, 24.</sense></entryFree>
spinea: <entryFree id="n45014" type="main" key="spi_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (another name for spionia), <sense id="n45014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spineola: <entryFree id="n45015" type="main" key="spi_ne^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spina</etym>, <sense id="n45015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small-leaved rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinesco: <entryFree id="n45016" type="hapax" key="spi_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to grow thorny</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 704</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinetum: <entryFree id="n45017" type="main" key="spi_ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thorn hedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thicket of thorns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spineta sentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45017.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotelis spineta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Helv. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spineus: <entryFree id="n45018" type="main" key="spi_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of thorns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
spiniensis: <entryFree id="n45019" type="main" key="Spi_ni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spīnĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity that guarded the fields against thorns</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spinifer: <entryFree id="n45020" type="main" key="spi_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spina-fero</etym>, <sense id="n45020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thorn-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda Pistricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 178</bibl></cit> (al. spinigera).</sense></entryFree>
spiniger: <entryFree id="n45021" type="hapax" key="spi_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spina-gero</etym>, <sense id="n45021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thorn-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>: stirpes, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 119.</sense></entryFree>
spino: <entryFree id="n45022" type="main" key="Spi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spīno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small stream near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to which divine honors were paid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinositas: <entryFree id="n45023" type="main" key="spi_no_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thorniness</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 29.</sense></entryFree>
spinosulus: <entryFree id="n45024" type="main" key="spi_no_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n45024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [spinosus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat thorny;</hi> hence, trop., in disputation, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinosus: <entryFree id="n45025" type="main" key="spi_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spina</etym>, <sense id="n45025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of thorns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prickles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prickly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45025.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae in spinosis locis pascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 17, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 15, 34, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinosior arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 67, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragmenta vertebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45025.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thorny.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45025.3" n="1" level="3"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crabbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum spinosum disserendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec enim spinosiora prius ut confitear me cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 51</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptorum nodosissimae et spinosissimae disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45025.4" n="2" level="3"> Of cares, <hi rend="ital">stinging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">galling. irritating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. spina, II.</sense></entryFree>
spinter: <entryFree id="n45026" type="main" key="spinter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spinter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spinther</orth>), <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prob. from <foreign lang="greek">sfigkth/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n45026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bracelet</hi> which kept its place on the arm by its own elasticity: <cit><quote lang="la">spinter, genus armillae quod mulieres antiquae gerere solebant bracchio summo sinistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeas spinter novom reconcinnarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 8</bibl> sq.; 5, 2, 56; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 646</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
spintharus: <entryFree id="n45027" type="main" key="Spintha^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spinthărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n45027.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave and amanuensis of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n45027.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An athlete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 68</bibl>. <cb n="SPIR" /></sense></entryFree>
spinther: <entryFree id="n45028" type="main" key="spinther1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spinther</orth>, v. spinter.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45029" type="main" key="Spinther2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spinther</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. P. Cornelius Spinther, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spintria: <entryFree id="n45030" type="main" key="spintri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spintrĭa</orth>, v. sphintria.</entryFree>
spintum: <entryFree id="n45031" type="main" key="Spintum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spintum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinturnicium: <entryFree id="n45032" type="hapax" key="spinturni_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spinturnīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spinturnix</etym>, <sense id="n45032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bird of ill-omen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinturnix: <entryFree id="n45033" type="main" key="spinturnix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spinturnix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">spinqari/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n45033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unsightly bird</hi>, otherwise unknown, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330 sq.</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 13, 17, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinula: <entryFree id="n45034" type="main" key="spi_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spina</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n45034.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little thorn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 49</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45034.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to spina, I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">A little backbone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spinus: <entryFree id="n45035" type="main" key="spi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<case>abl.</case> spinu, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 117</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blackthorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloe-tree</hi>: Prunus spinosa, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Insit. 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spio: <entryFree id="n45036" type="main" key="Spi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spīo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*speiw/</foreign>, <sense id="n45036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea - nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Nereus and Doris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 338</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 826</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spionia: <entryFree id="n45037" type="main" key="spi^o^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape-vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7:1" default="NO">3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO">3, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spionicus: <entryFree id="n45038" type="main" key="spi^o^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spionia</etym>, <sense id="n45038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> spionia: <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spira: <entryFree id="n45039" type="greek" key="spi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spei=ra</foreign>. <sense id="n45039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coiled</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twisted; a coil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spire</hi> (cf. orbis); <cit><quote lang="la">of a serpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 77</bibl>.—Of the grain of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 198</bibl>.—Of the intestines, Lact. Opif. Dei, 11, § 16.—</sense><sense id="n45039.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">spira dicitur et basis columnae unius tori aut duorum, et genus operis pistorii, et funis nauticus in orbem convolutus, ab eādem omnes similitudine. Pacuvius: Quid cessatis, socii, ejicere spiras sparteas? Ennius quidem hominum multitudinem ita appellat, cum ait: spiras legionibus nexunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=300" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 300</bibl></cit> Müll. (Ann. v. 501 Vahl., where the read. is nexit).—So, </sense><sense id="n45039.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The base of a column</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 56, § 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45039.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of twisted cake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cracknel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45039.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A coil of rope</hi>, Pac. ap. Fest. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n45039.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A braid of hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:396" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 396</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45039.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A twisted tie</hi> for fastening the hat under the chin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45039.7" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A confused crowd of men</hi>, Enn. ap. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
spirabilis: <entryFree id="n45040" type="main" key="spi_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spiro</etym>, <sense id="n45040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be breathed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good to breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respirable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45040.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra circumfusa undique est hac animali spirabilique naturā, cui nomen est aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45040.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n45040.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that serves to sustain life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vital</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sidera testor, caeli spirabile lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 600</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45040.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitted for breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respiratory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spiraculum: <entryFree id="n45041" type="main" key="spi_ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathinghole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air - hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiracle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 493</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 568</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:553" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 553</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 14, 16</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiraea: <entryFree id="n45042" type="main" key="spi_raea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīraea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">speirai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb meadowsweet</hi>: Spiraea, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiraeum: <entryFree id="n45043" type="main" key="Spi_raeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spīraeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory of Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiramen: <entryFree id="n45044" type="main" key="spi_ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>spiro</etym>. <sense id="n45044.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A breathing - hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage for the breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air-hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): spiramina Naris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 691</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 265 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui spiramina terris Esse putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 247</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spiramina laxanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45044.1" n="II" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum spiramina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reficit spiramina fessi ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:268" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessitus longo spiraminis actu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Magn. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interclusis spiraminibus interire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 133</bibl></cit>.— Of the Holy Ghost, Rust. Help. Carm. 77.</sense></entryFree>
spiramentum: <entryFree id="n45045" type="main" key="spi_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). <sense id="n45045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A breathing-hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">airhole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiracle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45045.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca relaxat Spiramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) in tectis certatim tenuia cera Spiramenta linunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: cavernarum (Aetnae), <pb n="1743" /> <cb n="SPIR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 343</bibl> (for which, shortly after: <cit><quote lang="la">spirandi viae): talparum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the lungs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato per cavernas radicibus spiramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45045.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing space</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a brief pause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla ac spiramenta temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine spiramento vel morā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 7, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45045.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; Macr. S. praef. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <trans><tr>a draught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spiratio: <entryFree id="n45046" type="main" key="spi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spiro</etym>. <sense id="n45046.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi> (post - class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 47" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:180" default="NO">180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45046.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor spirationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 185" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:197" default="NO">197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiratus: <entryFree id="n45047" type="hapax" key="spi_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 3, 2, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiridion: <entryFree id="n45048" type="main" key="Spi_ri^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spīrĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*speiridi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n45048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the rhetorician Glycon</hi>, Quint. § 1, 41 Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
spiritalis: <entryFree id="n45049" type="main" key="spi_ri^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtālis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭālis</orth> (the MSS. vary between the two forms), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spiritus</etym>. <sense id="n45049.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to air</hi> (post-Aug.): machinarum genus spiritale, quod apud eos (Graecos) <foreign lang="greek">pneumatiko/n</foreign> appellatur, <hi rend="ital">a kind of wind-instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes pulmonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 75, 1</bibl></cit>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">an air-passage</hi>, Lact. Opif. Dei, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">arteriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45049.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritual</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">substantiae quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: si spiritali lacte pectus irriges, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 44</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtālĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭāl-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">spiritually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro spiritaliter mundatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Paptism. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiritalitas: <entryFree id="n45050" type="main" key="spi_ri^ta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtālĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭāl-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spiritalis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n45050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spirituality</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spiritaliter: <entryFree id="n45051" type="main" key="spi_ri^ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. spiritalis <sense id="n45051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spiritualis: <entryFree id="n45052" type="main" key="spi_ri^tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭālis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭālĭter</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtŭālĭtas</orth>, v. spirital-.</entryFree>
spiritus: <entryFree id="n45053" type="main" key="spi_ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (scanned spĭrĭtus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Hymn. 1</bibl> <sense id="n45053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.; dat.</hi> SPIRITO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3030</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> only eccl. and late Lat., e. g. spirituum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 216:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 216, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>spiro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle blowing</hi> of air, <hi rend="ital">a breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi> (syn.: aura, flatus). </sense><sense id="n45053.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45053.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum a vento modus separat: vehementior enim spiritus ventus est, invicem spiritus leviter fluens aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 5</bibl>: spiritus Austri Imbricitor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 423 Vahl.), Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 114: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo spiritus non pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silentis vel placidi spiritus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus cum multo spiritu redditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45053.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45053.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The air</hi>: imber et ignis, spiritus et gravis terra, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 37</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 511 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">proximum (igni) spiritus, quem Graeci nostrique eodem vocabulo aëra appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam est commune quam spiritus vivis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestne tibi haec lux, Catilina, aut hujus caeli spiritus esse jucundus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An exhalation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus unguenti suavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedi odoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulfuris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Breathed air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus tu legiones difflavisti spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: (equus) saepe jubam quassit simul altam: Spiritus ex animā calida spumas agit albas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 507 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">creber spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentes oculi atque attractus ab alto Spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitus imo spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulmonibus inest raritas ... ad hauriendum spiritum aptissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffunditur spiritus per arterias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animantium vita tenetur, cibo, potione, spiritu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spiritum ducit, vivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:46:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 46, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillum atque otiosum spiritum ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longissima est complexio verborum, quae volvi uno spiritu potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus multos uno spiritu pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus nec crebro receptus concidat sententiam, nec eo usque trahatur, donec deficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusit vir egregius (Socrates) extremo spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl>: <cb n="SPIR" /> quorum usque ad extremum spiritum est provecta prudentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos idem Deus de suis spiritibus figuravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 42, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filiorum suorum postremum spiritum ore excipere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO">11, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO">11, 3, 53</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n45053.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45053.8" n="1" level="3"> In abstr., <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera arteria excipiat animam eam, quae ducta sit spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër spiritu ductus alit et sustentat animantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crevit onus neque habet quas ducat spiritus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 517</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: spiritum intercludere (includere), <hi rend="ital">to stop the breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choke</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae spiritum et vocem intercluserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 24, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">includere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The breath of a god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fieri non possent, nisi ea uno divino et continuato spiritu continerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>by a divine inspiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtam quasi divino quodam spiritu inflari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The breath of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum spiritum, quem naturae debeat, patriae reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos vero qui extremum spiritum in victoriā effudistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum spiritus hos regit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 336</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cum sensu doloris aliquo spiritus auferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem spiritu privare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 87, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merula spiritum reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>to expire</tr>, <tr>die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus tenues vanescat in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non effundere mihi spiritum videbar, sed tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum spiritum per ludibrium effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. supra, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n45053.11" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>,= suspirium, <hi rend="ital">a sigh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO">2, 29</bibl> (3, 27), 38.—</sense><sense id="n45053.12" n="5" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aspiration</hi> (asper and lenis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 572</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl> de Monos. Graec. et Lat. 19. —</sense><sense id="n45053.13" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hiss of a snake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 180</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45053.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45053.15" n="A" level="2"> (Class.) <hi rend="ital">A haughty spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi> (esp. freq. in the <number>plur.</number>; syn. animi). </sense><sense id="n45053.16" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (in the best prose only in <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, which are wanting in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">regio spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem hominem! quā irā! quo spiritu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos ejus spiritus Siciliensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum fiduciae ac spiritūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia Hieronis, inflata adhuc regiis animis ac muliebri spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii spiritūs animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnitudine rerum spiritum ducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore majorem rides Turbonis in armis Spiritum et incessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidit spiritus ille tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritu divino tactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non negaverim fuisse alti spiritūs viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45053.17" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae, credo, meae me nimis extulerunt ac mihi nescio quos spiritus attulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noratis animos ejus ac spiritus tribunicios, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unius tribuni militum animos ac spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos sibi spiritus, sumpserat, ut ferendus non videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> in re militari sumere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam Dion regios spiritus repressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spiritus plebes sumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui honores subdere spiritus potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remittant spiritus, comprimant animos suos, sedent arrogantiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum se vim ac spiritus fregisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohibuit spiritus ejus Thrasea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antipater, qui probe nosset spiritus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.18" n="B" level="2"> (Mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose.) <hi rend="ital">Spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45053.19" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoslibet occupat artus Spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl>: spiritum Phoebus mihi, Phoebus artem Carminis dedit, <hi rend="ital">poetic spirit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Spiritum Graiae tenuem Camenae Parca non mendax dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis Pindarico spiritus ore tonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 40: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator generosi spiritŭs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>: avidus (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">to\ e)piqumhtiko/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the desiring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coveting soul</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam comoedia necne poëma Esset, quaesivere: quod acer spiritus ac vis Nec verbis nec rebus inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majoris operis ac spiritūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alti spiritūs plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus magni spiritus est et recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui spiritus illi, Quis vultus vocisque sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 648</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45053.20" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: Coriolanus hostiles jam tum spiritus<cb n="SPIR" />  gerens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 17</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45053.21" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (like anima, and the Engl. <hi rend="ital">soul</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a beloved object</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45053.22" n="2" level="3"> Spiritus, personified, <hi rend="ital">a spirit</hi> (late Lat.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">esp., Spiritus Sanctus or simply Spiritus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Holy Ghost</tr>, <tr>Holy Spirit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare per Deum et per Christum et per Spiritum Sanctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocens ille Spiritus,</quote> <trans><tr>an evil spirit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spiritus nigri,</quote> <trans><tr>evil spirits</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 3, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spiro: <entryFree id="n45054" type="main" key="spi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.]. </sense><sense id="n45054.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow</hi>, etc. (cf. flo). </sense><sense id="n45054.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45054.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">freta circum Fervescunt graviter spirantibus incita flabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 428</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 532</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obturatis, quā spiraturus est ventus, cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 58, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emicat ex oculis, spiratque e pectore flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>breathes forth</tr>, <tr>bursts forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequatae spirant aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter spirantis copia thymbrae,</quote> <trans><tr>strongscented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">semper odoratis spirabunt floribus arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:211" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu spirent cinnama surdum,</quote> <trans><tr>emit a slight fragrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā vada non spirant, nec fracta remurmurat unda,</quote> <trans><tr>roar</tr>, <tr>rage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 291</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fervet fretis spirantibus aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>boiling up</tr>, <tr>foaming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 327</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respire</hi> (the class. signif. of the word; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">anhelo): cum spirantes mixtas hinc ducimus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deseri a me, dum quidem spirare potero, nefas judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne spirare quidem sine metu possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q.
