Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer et crebro spirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querulum spirat,</quote> <trans><tr>breathes plaintively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45054.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be alive</hi> (usu. in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui ab eo (Clodio) spirante forum putent potuisse defendi, cujus non restiterit cadaveri curia (corresp. to vivus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in vivi etiam et spirantis capite bustum imponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 52, 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">margarita viva ac spirantia saxis avelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina inter hostium cadavera repertus est, paululum etiam spirans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirantia consulit exta,</quote> <trans><tr>still panting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt ausi admovere (corpori), velut spiranti, manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:430" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 430</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirant venae corque adhuc paviduin salit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 756" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 756</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45054.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of aspirated letters: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (litteris) nullae apud eos dulcius spirant,</quote> <trans><tr>sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45054.9" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi> (the fig. taken from a favorable wind): <cit><quote lang="la">quod si tam facilis spiraret Cynthia nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 18), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">di maris et terrae ... spirate secundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 529</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be alive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur Laelii mens spirare etiam in scriptis, Galbae autem vis occidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spirat adhuc amor Vivuntque calores Aeoliae puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of life-like representations by painting, sculpture, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">excudent alii spirantia mollius aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parii lapidis spirantia signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirat et arguta picta tabella manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:84:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 84, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:10:7" default="NO">11, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be poetically inspired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the lyric spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod spiro, et placeo, si placeo, tuum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit> (Orell. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n45054.12" n="4" level="3"> Spirare alte, altius, <hi rend="ital">to be puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">arrogant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eusebium alte spirantem addixere poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45054.13" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emit</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; not in Cic.; syn. exhalo). </sense><sense id="n45054.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diomedis equi spirantes naribus ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam spirantes ore Chimaerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 705</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flammas spirantes boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyros spirare secundos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to breathe feebly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:436" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiaeque comae divinum vertice odorem Spiravere,</quote> <trans><tr>exhaled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia Poppaeana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:466" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vidit vastos telluris hiatus Divinam spirare fidem (i. e. oracula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficto Corpori animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45054.17" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be full of; to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">express</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest; to design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intend</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): tantum spirantes aequo certamine bellum. <pb n="1744" /> <cb n="SPIS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 392</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollem spirare quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae spirabat amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquietum hominem et tribunatum etiam nunc spirantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris facta spirans,</quote> <trans><tr>imitating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 411</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem spirat in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:740" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirantes proelia dira effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:398" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 398</bibl></cit>.— Often with <hi rend="ital">neutr. adj.</hi> used adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 53: <cit><quote lang="la">majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragicum satis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 166</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam indomitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spirula: <entryFree id="n45055" type="main" key="spi_ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spīrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>spira, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n45055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small twisted cake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cracknel</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spissamentum: <entryFree id="n45056" type="main" key="spissa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>spisso</etym>, that which is used to compress or stop up any thing, <sense id="n45056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stopple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plug</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">firmiori (quam cera) spissamento opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissamento facto de harundinum foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeniculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 49, 4, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:3" default="NO">12, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO">12, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spissatio: <entryFree id="n45057" type="main" key="spissa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condensation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">packing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram calcavit et pressit: negat quicquam esse hac spissatione efficacius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spisse: <entryFree id="n45058" type="main" key="spisse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. spissus <sense id="n45058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
spissesco: <entryFree id="n45059" type="main" key="spissesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [spissus], <hi rend="ital">to become thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condense</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spissigradus: <entryFree id="n45060" type="hapax" key="spissi^gra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissĭgrădus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spissegradior</etym>, <sense id="n45060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow-paced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos duco homines spissigradissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spissitas: <entryFree id="n45061" type="main" key="spissi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spissus</etym>, <sense id="n45061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compactness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">density</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quercus (opp. raritas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spissitudo: <entryFree id="n45062" type="main" key="spissi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">density</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consistency</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aëris crassi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:30:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 4" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:5" default="NO">5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nimis liquida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissitudinem ejus absolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spisso: <entryFree id="n45063" type="main" key="spisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spisso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45063.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condense</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; esp. freq. in Pliny the elder; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">denso): omne lac igne spissatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 238</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spissatum lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 7, 24, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinae modo spissatur in panem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis densum spissatus in aëra transit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 250</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aquilo) sanum corpus spissat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 83, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 10</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45063.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to urge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi> an action, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi> it <hi rend="ital">more rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissare officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spissus: <entryFree id="n45064" type="main" key="spissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root spi-, to press; cf. Lith. spitu</etym>. <sense id="n45064.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi> (mostly poet and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: crassus, densas): durata ac spissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 222</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">corona Non tam spissa viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 509</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 19, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramis laurea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 336</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>of a close texture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis juncturis aquam excludentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 621</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:24" default="NO">8, 13, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 604</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spississima arbor (ebenus et buxus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 204</bibl></cit>: minimum ex nequitiā levissimumque ad alios redundat; <cit><quote lang="la">quod pessimum ex illā est et, ut ita dicam, spississimum, domi remanet et premit habentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45064.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time. </sense><sense id="n45064.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">late</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tarda et spissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in utroque genere dicendi exitus spissi et producti esse debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45064.3" n="2" level="3"> Spissum illud amanti est verbum, Veniet nisi venit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 77</bibl>: nihil ego spei credo, omnes res spissas facit, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 15</bibl>; Pac., Titin., and Turp. ib. sq.: haruspices si quid boni promittunt, pro spisso evenit; <cit><quote lang="la">Id quod mali promittunt, praesentiarum est,</quote> <trans><tr>slowly</tr>, <tr>late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45064.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thick</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in quick succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fast</hi>, = continuus, creber (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">spississima basia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45064.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi> (rare but class.): <cb n="SPLE" /> spissum sane opus et operosum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id erit spissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est aliquanto spissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 145</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">spissē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n45064.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcare carbones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 31</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45064.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45064.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Slowly</hi>: tu nimis spisse atque tarde incedis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet hoc senectus, cum pigra est ipsa, ut spisse omnia videantur confieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 393:4" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 393, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spisse atque vix ad Antonium pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 36, 138</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nascimur spissius quam emorimur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 392, 29</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45064.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basiavit me spissius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 18, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spithama: <entryFree id="n45065" type="greek" key="spi^tha^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spĭthăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spiqamh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a span</hi> (syn. palmus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splanchnoptes: <entryFree id="n45066" type="greek" key="splanchnoptes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splanchnoptes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">splagxno/pths</foreign>, <sense id="n45066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the roaster of entrails; a bronze statue by Styppax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:81" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splen: <entryFree id="n45067" type="greek" key="sple_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">splh/n</foreign>, <sense id="n45067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the milt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spleen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:131" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 15, 80, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:185" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 120, § 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">sum petulanti splene cachinno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splendentia: <entryFree id="n45068" type="main" key="splendentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>splendeo</etym>, <sense id="n45068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 57, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splendeo: <entryFree id="n45069" type="main" key="splende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (<sense id="n45069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> splendui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 27</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be bright; to gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glisten</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in Cic. only once in the trop. sense; syn.: luceo, fulgeo, niteo). </sense><sense id="n45069.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sparsis hastis longis campus splendet et horret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Sat. v. 15 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi splendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendens stella candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scenaï simul varios splendere decores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 984</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claro splendere colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendet tremulo sub lumine pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra splendentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes fulgenti splendent auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendet focus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paternum Splendet salinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cubiculum) marmore splendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glycera splendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nec Lacaenae splendet adulterae Famosus hospes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fuco splendente genas ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:79:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 79, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendebat hilare poculis convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 24, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45069.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>: virtus lucet in tenebris splendetque per sese semper, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendere alienā invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores in equestri ordine splendentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">splendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendentior igne clipeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigantom. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splendesco: <entryFree id="n45070" type="main" key="splendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendesco</orth> (<sense id="n45070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> dŭi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 27</bibl>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [splendeo], <hi rend="ital">to become bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to derive lustre</hi> from a thing (rare; in Cic. only in a trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n45070.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiat sulco attritus splendescere vomer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus Aetnaeā caelum splendescere flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ... succo pinguis olivi Splendescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius usu splendescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largo splendescat ignis ture,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 691" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 691</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45070.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam incultum, quod non splendescat oratione, Cic. Par. prooem. § 3: canorum illud in voce splendescit etiam in senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Sen. 9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam splendescit (opus) lima, sed atteritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splendico: <entryFree id="n45071" type="main" key="splendi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkle</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 162, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depiles genae levi pueritiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 191, 12.</sense></entryFree>
splendide: <entryFree id="n45072" type="main" key="splendi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. splendidus <sense id="n45072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
splendido: <entryFree id="n45073" type="main" key="splendi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>splendidus</etym>, <sense id="n45073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make shining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polish</hi> (post-class.): dentes, App. Mag. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
splendidus: <entryFree id="n45074" type="main" key="splendi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>splendeo</etym>, <sense id="n45074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: nitidus, lucidus, coruscus). </sense><sense id="n45074.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45074.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: o magna templa caelitum, commixta stellis splendidis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 227 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">signa caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum cum aequaliter totum erit splendidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 351</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto splendidior quam cetera sidera fulget Lucifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol splendidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:123" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 123</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidissimus candor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color (with flam neus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostro crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: venabula. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:419" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons splendidio vitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: Galatea Splendidior <cb n="SPLE" /> vitro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 791</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor sudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1187</bibl></cit>: bilis, <hi rend="ital">bright yellow</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">xolh\ canqh/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 141</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrea bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n45074.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of style of living, dress, etc., <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi> (syn. magnificus): <cit><quote lang="la">quorum in villā ac domo nihil splendidum fuit praeter ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendida domus gaudet regali gaza,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 637</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidus et virilis cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo (opp. luxuriosus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundas res splendidiores facit amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45074.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45074.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius, amplus): C. Plotius, eques Romanus splendidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir splendidissimus atque ornatissimus civitatis suae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo propter virtutem splendidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidissima ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa splendidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">splendida facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">splendida et grandis oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 273</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidius et magnificentius (genus dicendi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 201</bibl></cit>; cf.: figurarum commentis splendida loca attentare, <hi rend="ital">brilliant passages</hi> of a speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidis nominibus illuminatus est versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidioribus verbis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox suavis et splendida,</quote> <trans><tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de te splendida Minos Fecerit arbitria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45074.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (with the accessory idea of mere appearance, opp. to what is real or actual), <hi rend="ital">showy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specious</hi>, = speciosus: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam solido quam splendido nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendens culpae splendida verba tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 240</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45074.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 203</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliantly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45074.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare magnifice splendideque convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus splendidissime expositus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45074.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">brilliantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta aetas honeste ac splendide,</quote> <trans><tr>honorably</tr>, <tr>with distinction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidius contra regem quam, etc., bellum gerere, Auct. B. Alex. 24, 2: ornate splendideque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parentem Splendide mendax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidissime natus,</quote> <trans><tr>of very high birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45074.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45074.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ostentatiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parum se splendide gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>with too little show</tr>, <tr>meanly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splendifice: <entryFree id="n45075" type="hapax" key="splendi^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>splendeo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n45075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intermicans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
splendifico: <entryFree id="n45076" type="hapax" key="splendi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illumine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 912</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splenditenens: <entryFree id="n45077" type="main" key="splendi^te^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendĭtĕnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n45077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resplendent</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. 15, 6.</sense></entryFree>
splendor: <entryFree id="n45078" type="main" key="splendor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>splendeo</etym>, <sense id="n45078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sheen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45078.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45078.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fulgor, nitor): splendor acer adurit saepe oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor clipeo clarior, Plaut Mil. 1, 1, 1: caelum splendore plenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Merc. 5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:366" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri (with nitor gemmae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussine in splendorem dare bullas has foribus nostris?</quote> <trans><tr>to be polished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus vestis purpureaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificus Babylonicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1029" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1029</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaï,</quote> <trans><tr>clearness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 89" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis phengitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitores et splendores auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: tremuli splendores, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olyb. 123. —</sense><sense id="n45078.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of style of living, etc., <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuousness</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. magnificentia): (majores nostri) in publicā dignitate omnia ad gloriam splendoremque revocarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem horum aliquid offendit, si amicorum catervae, si splendor, si nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor domūs atque victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45078.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, etc. (so most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">honesti homines et summo splendore praediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summorum hominum splendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 200</bibl></cit>: senator<pb n="1745" /> <cb n="SPOL" />  populi Romani, splendor ordinis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 140</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi et vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catonis splendorem maculare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum splendor omnis et amplitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendore nominis capti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio ejus habebat in voce magnum splendorem,</quote> <trans><tr>clearness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71, 250</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splendorifer: <entryFree id="n45079" type="main" key="splendo_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splendōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>splendor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n45079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing brightness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Judic. Dom. 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spleneticus: <entryFree id="n45080" type="main" key="sple_ne_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēnētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>splen</etym>, <sense id="n45080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">affected with spleen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splenetic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl> (al. splenici).</sense></entryFree>
spleniatus: <entryFree id="n45081" type="hapax" key="sple_ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēnĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>splenium</etym>, <sense id="n45081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plastered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a plaster</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patch on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
splenicus: <entryFree id="n45082" type="greek" key="sple_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">splhniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splenetic; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a person affected with spleen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a splenetic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:79" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 47, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:128" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 47, § 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splenites: <entryFree id="n45083" type="greek" key="sple_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">splhni/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a splenetic person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
splenium: <entryFree id="n45084" type="greek" key="sple_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">splēnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">splh/nion</foreign>. <sense id="n45084.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Milt-waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spleenwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45084.1" n="II" level="1"> (Because of its likeness to the spleen in form and color.) <hi rend="ital">A plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:104" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 104</bibl> (Jahn, spleniolum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:22" default="NO">8, 33, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spodium: <entryFree id="n45085" type="greek" key="spo^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spo/dion</foreign>. <sense id="n45085.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dross of metals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:172" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 52, § 172</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45085.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ashes</hi> of vegetable matter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 38, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spodos: <entryFree id="n45086" type="greek" key="spo^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏdos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">spodo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 128</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
spoletium: <entryFree id="n45087" type="main" key="Spo_le_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Spōlētĭum</orth> (afterwards called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spōlētum</orth>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 592</bibl> P.; but whether so as early as the class. period is doubtful, owing to the uncertainty of the readings in the MSS. of Livy, Suetonius, and Florus; cf. Duk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Umbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Spoleto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 31</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45087.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spōlē-tīnus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Spoletium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spoletinus T. Matrinius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">P. Cominius Spoletinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 271</bibl></cit>: lagenae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wine of Spoletium</hi> (of excellent quality), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:120" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 120</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spoletina bibis,</quote> <trans><tr>Spoletian wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 116</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spō-lētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Spoletium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 43</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.—‡ </sense><sense id="n45087.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Spōlētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Spoletium</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 592</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
spoliabilis: <entryFree id="n45088" type="main" key="spo^li^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>spolio</etym>, <sense id="n45088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be stripped off</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Mercat. Nestor Serm. 12, 2.</sense></entryFree>
spoliarium: <entryFree id="n45089" type="main" key="spo^li^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>spolium</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n45089.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place in the amphitheatre where the clothes were stripped from the slain gladiators who were dragged thither</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45089.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a den of robbers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">murderers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutthroat place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
spoliatio: <entryFree id="n45090" type="main" key="spo^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spolio</etym>, <sense id="n45090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoliation</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45090.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantā spoliatione omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliationes fanorum atque oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45090.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spoliator: <entryFree id="n45091" type="main" key="spo^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiler</hi> (rare but class.): eorum (monumentorum), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:36:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 36, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pupilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spoliatrix: <entryFree id="n45092" type="main" key="spo^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spoliator</etym>, <sense id="n45092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that robs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillages</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spoils</hi>: Venus spoliatrix, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:29:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 29, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spoliatus: <entryFree id="n45093" type="main" key="spo^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of spolio.</entryFree>
spolio: <entryFree id="n45094" type="main" key="spo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spolium</etym>, <sense id="n45094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob of clothing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45094.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.; syn. exuo): <cb n="SPOL" /> Phalarim vestitu spoliare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules spoliari hominem et virgas expediri jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papirius spoliari magistrum equitum ac virgas et secures expediri jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus caesi hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallum caesum torque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus jacentis uno torque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentem veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folliculos leguminum,</quote> <trans><tr>to strip off</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45094.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil; to deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despoil;</hi> usually: aliquem (aliquid) aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rob one of something</hi> (the predominant signif. of the word; syn. praedor). </sense><sense id="n45094.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysalus me miserum spoliavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meos perduelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatis effossisque domibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:305" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 305</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars spoliant aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliare et nudare monumenta antiquissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliata fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45094.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Aliquem (aliquid) aliquā re: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatur lumine terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliari fortunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonium omni argento spoliasti ac depeculatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Gallia omni nobilitate spoliaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam vetere exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliata armis navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus spoliatum lumine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 935</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla sociis spoliavit Ulixen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penetralia donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 246</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 514: te spoliare pudicā Conjuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea philosophia, quae spoliat nos judicio, privat approbatione, omnibus orbat sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatum hominem famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ornamento quodam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliare atque orbare forum voce eruditā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">juris civilis scientiam, ornatu suo spoliare atque denudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45094.5" n="(g)" level="5"> In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems spoliata capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>stripped of his locks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45094.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spoliorum causā vis hominem occidere, spoliasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 145</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">plundered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despoiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illo regno spoliatius,</quote> <trans><tr>more impoverished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
spolium: <entryFree id="n45095" type="main" key="spo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">spŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root spal- (skal-); cf.: populor, calamitas, calvus</etym>. <sense id="n45095.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spoil</hi> of an animal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hide</hi> of an animal stripped off (so only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pelles et spolia ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:954" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 954</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:426" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudis (i. e. arietis Phrixei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperei monstri (i. e. Medusae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:615" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45095.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the arms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">armor stripped from a defeated enemy</hi>; hence, in gen., any thing taken from the enemy, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; usu. in <number>plur.</number>; cf.: exuviae, praeda): Salmacida spolia sine sudore et sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl> (Trag. v. 36 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">spolia ducis hostium caesi suspenso ferculo gerens in Capitolium ascendit ibique, Juppiter Feretri, inquit, haec tibi victor Romulus rex regia arma fero templumque dedico, sedem opimis spoliis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit> (v. opimus): <cit><quote lang="la">spoliis decorata est regia fixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliorum causā hominem occidere ... cruenta spolia detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:145 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 145 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa spolia praeferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
